text: SAMANTHA DARKO (18) opens her eyes. She squints as the su sun shrinks her pupils to pinhole size. She sits up slowl looks around... and finds herself in midst of an endless wheat field. Sam is pretty and demure. Her coppery hair flows past her shoulders. Disoriented, she stands and gazes at the infin golden shimmer. Amber waves of grain. Patches of forest i the distance. It's quiet. Serene. Beautiful... She smiles, and starts walking.
She emerges at the shoulder of a rural stretch of highway Arkansas. Adjacent to her position, on the other side of deserted lanes, is a TRUCK STOP.
Amongst the TRACTOR-TRAILERS parked in the back lot is a white, late-80s model CHEVROLET CELEBRITY. Sam makes her across the asphalt toward the vehicle...

COREY RICHARDSON (18) is asleep, curled up in the recline driver's seat of the car. She awakens when Sam gets in on passenger side and slams the door shut. Corey has the look of a typical rebellious teen: dyed hai piercings, a little grungy. She rubs the sleep from her e greeting the new day with something less than enthusiasm. finds a soft pack of CIGARETTES and lights one.
What time is it?
Early...
Corey adjusts her seat. She takes a long drag and chokes, then spits out the window. She starts the car...

Corey's car cruises along the flat, open road. She cranks the VOLUME on the car's CASSETTE DECK, nodding her head t early-90s ALT. ROCK (suggestion: Into Dust, by Mazzy Star Sam looks out the window at the passing scenery: FARMERS work in the fields; a BILLBOARD advertising a local restaurant; ROADSIDE DITCHES filled with trash... She fixates on a MINIVAN travelling in the slow lane. It contains the all-American NUCLEAR FAMILY: MOTHER, FATHER three SIBLINGS, one of them being a YOUNGSTER. The Youngs makes a face at Sam as they pass by...
Corey glances at the CONTROL PANEL when she HEARS the eng start to RATTLE. She sees that the TEMPERATURE GAUGE has the red and her CHECK ENGINE LIGHT is on.
Shit...

By the time they pull over on the side of the empty highw steam billows out from under the hood. Sam gets out of th car to check on it while Corey remains behind the wheel. Sam peeks under the hood, trying to clear the air of the steam. It sounds like someone is rhythmically TAPPING the inside of the engine with a hammer.
Turn it off.
(poking her head out the
What?
Turn off the car.
Corey does so.
Doesn't look too good...
How do you know?
It smells funny.

Sam looks up when she HEARS a PICK-UP TRUCK coming toward them. Corey watches as she steps out to wave it down... The pick-up pulls over ahead of them. CHRIS HOLT (24), a brawny, attractive young man, gets out. When Corey sees h she gets out too.
Thanks for stopping. Our car's messed up.
What happened?
My check engine light came on, then it just started smoking, and ticking and shit.
As Chris pokes around under the hood, Sam and Corey excha looks. Chris pops opens the COOLANT CAP and burns his han the steam explosion.
(shaking it off) Blew your water pump. Can't drive it.
Fuck me...
El Reno's just a couple miles up ahead. Can call for a tow there. C'mon, I'll give you a lift.

All three crammed into the cab of the pick-up, they drive through the center of El Reno, Oklahoma (population 16,00 and see some of the locals out and about [MUSIC MONTAGE fueled by early- to mid-90s era GRUNGE ROCK (suggestion: As You Are, by Nirvana) -- reminiscent of the `Middlesex Middle School Montage' in DONNIE DARKO]: AGATHA DOWDY (54), an employee of the local DINER, sits o bench in front of the establishment smoking a cigarette. manager, TED MONCTON (50), calls her back inside...

RANDY EVANS (21), RUTH GIBBENS (18) and JEFF (21) and MIK JIMENEZ (20) loiter in the parking lot of a LIQUOR STORE. TRUDY POTTER (39) flirts with FATHER HOMEIJER (54), a Catholic priest, outside the BANK. A BANK SIGN shows the -- 12:00 PM -- then flashes to the DATE -- JUNE 18, 1995. OFFICER RYAN O'DELL (31) has pulled over a PRETTY LADY an uses his uniform to impress more than intimidate... They come up on VIETNAM TOM (48), who ambles along the si of the road against traffic, and he waves to them as they pass. He wears old, weather beaten clothes and a multi- colored SKI MASK over his head and face...
Sam swivels her head to watch Tom. ANOTHER CAR passes and waves to it as well. Chris picks up on her curiosity.
He waves to everybody... Just kinda walks up and down.
Resident nutcase?
People call him Vietnam Tom.
He was in the war?
He thinks he was... kind of a joke, ya know?
Sam continues to stare until he disappears out of sight.. PAN DOWN to a PUDDLE by the side of the road. As a CAR TI splashes through it, PAN UP TO FIND:

Dusty's auto repair shop, which is nothing more than a bi garage attached to his old two-story house. Corey's car h been towed there, and DUSTY GIBBENS (37; father of Ruth Gibbens), the lone mechanic, tinkers around under the hoo Sam and Corey sit on the front steps of the house waiting bored as hell. A PIT BULL laps at a nameless treat wedged into a crack in the walkway. The girls are forced to get when Ruth (from outside the liquor store) comes to the do
Can I get out?

Sam and Corey move so that she can exit the house. Ruth's look is hardened, rough around the edges -- she appears o than her 18 years. The girls watch as she enters the garage to see her fathe She whispers something in his ear, and Dusty hands her so CASH, which she pockets then kisses him on the cheek. Aft this, Dusty wipes his hands on his greasy jeans and comes outside to address Corey and Sam.
Yeah... it's the water pump.
So what do we do?
I can order you up a new one. Probably be a couple days.
Great. This the only show in town?
Cheapest and the best. But you want me to call the tow guy back here, no problem. Probably charge you another hundred bucks, but he'll get ya wherever you wanna go.
Just go ahead and fix it.

Phil Coulter (48), the proprietor of a dingy little roads motel, looks up from a hardcover copy of Stephen King's GERALD'S GAME when the girls enter. They each have a SMAL SUITCASE and a BACKPACK in tow.
What can I do for you?
We need a room.

He gets out a notebook and lays it out on the counter. Co finds a pen and starts to fill out a registration form... NEWS BULLETIN about the O.J. SIMPSON TRIAL plays at a LOW VOLUME on a TELEVISION in the b.g.
How much is it?
$39 a night. How many you stayin'?
Just a couple, we hope.
He takes the KEY to ROOM 15 off the rack.
Well... welcome to El Reno.

Sam and Corey arrive at the liquor store, which is down t street from the motel. Ruth, Randy Evans, and Jeff and Mi Jimenez are loitering in the parking lot in a similar fas to how they were earlier in the day.
You get checked into the motel alright?
Yep.
Randy seems surprised that Ruth has already made their acquaintance. He wastes no time in introducing himself.
My name's Randy. This is Mike and Jeff. Guess you already know Ruth.
Corey.
I'm Samantha.
They shake, and Corey seems at ease mingling with the strangers. Sam hangs back a little.
One of you guys mind pickin' us up a bottle of something?
I think I can manage that. What do you want?
I don't know. Vodka, whiskey, whatever.
Corey looks to Sam, who produces some cash. Randy takes t money and heads for the store.
Be right back...
After he's gone, there's an uncomfortable moment of silen in which Mike and Jeff ogle the girls mischievously. Ruth stares at them in a different way. She seems somewhat resentful of their presence.
From Virginia, huh?
Yep.
I saw your plates...
Corey and Sam both nod in mundane acknowledgment. Another beat of uncomfortable silence.
Where to?
What?
Your obviously just passin' through here.
We're on the way to Vegas.
Ruth snickers.
Well... you need anything besides booze, you just lemme know.
Randy comes out of the store with a bottle in a brown bag passes it off to Corey, along with some change.
Thanks a lot, man.
No problem. You guys wanna come back to my place for bit? Bring your bottle, we got some weed...
Corey looks like she's considering it, but --
I'm really tired.
She takes Sam's signal.
Yeah, I think we'll just head back. Been a long day, ya know?
That's cool.

The clock on the BANK SIGN shows 3:30 AM -- then flashes JUNE 19, 1995... It changes again, this time to a countdo to the JULY 4TH FIREWORKS CELEBRATION: 15 DAYS, 17 HOURS, MINUTES, 57 SECONDS... 56 SECONDS... 55 SECONDS...

Sam awakens suddenly from a nightmare. She lies atop the blankets wearing a T-SHIRT and BOXER SHORTS. She looks ov and sees Corey passed out on the other full-size bed. TWO PLASTIC CUPS, EMPTY SODA CANS, and the BOTTLE are on nightstand between them, the liquor partially consumed. There's a digital CLOCK/RADIO that reads 3:30 AM. The TV is on, and a late night INFOMERCIAL for the GEORGE FOREMAN GRILL plays. Sam stares at the screen as the imag WARP and RIPPLE in a way that coincides with an increasin loud, rumbling TREMOR from outside... In a daze, she gets up and slowly walks closer to the television. She reaches out with her RIGHT HAND, about to touch it... A strange, abrupt HARD CUT TO:
Sam is in a grassy field behind the motel, moving away fr the building. She wears a HOODED SWEATSHIRT, JEANS, and h RIGHT HAND is wrapped in some sort of MAKESHIFT BANDAGE.

There's a GASH in the side of her forehead by her temple, with what looks to be a SHARD OF METAL partially embedded under the skin and protruding from the wound. She is without expression, and her movements are rhythmic fluid. A tall AERMOTOR WINDMILL towers in the distance...

A glimpse of the field through Sam's eyes shows a phosphorescent PLANE OF DESTINY -- an intricate grid in w objects organic and inorganic dwell in assigned positions and move according to a framework of set paths. A JACKRABBIT follows a silvery VECTOR SPEAR like propheti life-gel to its burrow... COSMIC ENERGY burns around a CLUSTER OF STONES... Miniature VECTOR SPEARS lead a SWARM INSECTS around in a circle and then BUZZING right past Sa field of vision... It's infinitely complex, but Sam sees through it clearly. has no vector spear of her own to guide her, but she is cognizant of her path... She moves toward the WINDMILL.

Sam appears at the foot of the windmill tower. A giant WA TANK squats beside it. Remaining stoic, she looks up and Vietnam Tom sitting atop the windmill platform, more than feet up, staring back down at her through the eyes holes his ski mask...

Tom peers over the edge of the small platform, the surfac which is littered with TATTERED CLOTHING, a WATER BOTTLE, CANS OF FOOD and SCRAPS OF A TARP. He cradles a RIFLE in arms... His focus shifts from what is at the foot of the windmill what is sitting right beside him -- REVEAL Sam. Her legs dangle over the side of the platform and she stares off into distance.
The sky's so beautiful here...
Tom looks in the direction that she stares and then back her. Sam turns to meet his gaze...
But we can't stay.

Sam sees through to the core of his physical being, the DYNAMIC CENTER of which lingers pulsating in a translucen circle around his chest. Magnified NEURONS in TOM'S BRAIN send ELECTRIC IMPULSES t release NEUROTRANSMITTERS, which excite OTHER NEURONS... Tom slowly reaches out to touch Sam, but an invisible FOR FIELD makes contact impossible. RIPPLES swell throughout clear plasma-like barrier from where he touched it, and h hand remains glued to the spot. Sam extends her bandaged right hand, and presses it to Vietnam Tom's as if she were touching a mirrored image of herself. The contact generates more RIPPLES, and as TREMORS begin shake the windmill a DISTORTED VOICE echoes throughout th
15 days... 18 hours... 45 minutes... 6 seconds. That is when the world will end.

A CYLINDRICAL PORTAL opens up below them, gaping and swir like God's eye on the mouth of a liquid tornado. As Sam a Tom stand in unison to peer into it, a HEXAGONAL PLATE OF WHITE LIGHT emanates from within --

They appear near the foot of the windmill, sprinting away from it together. Tom has his rifle, and he looks up to t sky as he runs... ...there's a brilliant flash of GREEN LIGHT -- deafening THUNDER -- a blinding EXPLOSION --

Sam awakens to the morning sun blinding her. She struggle peer through the harsh whiteness at a looming figure that stands over her. Her eyes adjust to discover that it's a policeman -- Officer O'Dell.
`Fraid you can't sleep here, miss.
Sam sits up and realizes she's on a bench at a bus stop n the side of the road. O'Dell's tone is innocuous, and whe she looks up at him again she sees that he's grinning.
Got anyplace to be?
Sam manages to find her voice.
The motel.
She takes his hand and rises.
O'Dell's cruiser pulls into the motel parking lot, which uncharacteristically full. A FIRE TRUCK is parked by the of the road. Just then, a call comes in on the POLICE RAD
We got some kinda situation at Frank Haley's farm...
Copy that. I'm here now...

Where the towering windmill once stood is now only a CRAT about 5 feet deep and 10 feet in diameter, with charred b of wood and metal strewn everywhere. GROUND WATER spurts the broken WELL SEAL... And a cantaloupe-sized METEORITE sits in the center of th crater. Two FIREMEN haul out the meteorite with gloved hands as S and O'Dell arrive on the scene. Corey is already there looking on, as well as Chris Holt, who gave them a ride i town, Phil Coulter from the motel, and other local CITIZE FRANK HALEY (54), the farmer who owns the land, is fuming
Un-fuckin'-believable...
The Firemen drop the porous, misshapen clod by his feet.
It's still warm.
You know how much it's gonna cost me to replace this goddamn windmill?
Officer O'Dell steps up beside him and kicks the meteorit with his boot.
Sell this thing off to some meteorologist nerd club, I bet you could do okay.
Ya think?
Sam looks down at a CAN OF FOOD on the ground amidst some scorched CLOTHING. O'Dell takes note of some other CANNED GOODS and SCRAPS OF TARP.
What's all that stuff, Frank?
That whack job Tom's been squattin' up there the last couple a' months. Thinks he's the goddamn town watchman... (BEAT) You think he got blown up?
Everyone scans the ground for signs of human remains unti Phil pipes up:
I saw him out in front of the motel early this morning, alive and well.
(SARCASTIC) Oh, well, thank heavens...

Sam turns and peers up at the WATER TANK. It's marred by MARKS and DENTS from the explosion. As she tilts her head looks closer, she can almost pick out a shape created by damage -- a negative image like the Shroud of Turin... ...in the form of a bizarre, toothy-grinned FACE OF A GIA MONSTER BUNNY.
Sam and Corey are on their way back to the motel room whe they turn and see that Chris has followed them.
Hey...
Hey.
So you guys stayed here last night?
One of us did.
Sam gives Corey a look. Chris decides to ignore the comme
What's up with your car?
It's gonna take a couple days.
For a water pump?
Sam and Corey shrug.
None of my business, but...
He's distracted when a brand new `95 BMW pulls up and par nearby. JEREMY FRAME (25), a thin, pale young man hops ou and hustles into the field toward the crash site.
What?
Chris regains his train of thought:
I was just gonna say, if you wanted, I could give you a ride back.
He looks right at Sam when he says this. He then glances at Corey, as if just remembering she was there.
You too. I mean, I could give you both a ride.
To Middlesex, Virginia? Do you have any clue how far that is?
(SHEEPISH) I got some time...
Sam looks as though she's about to say something but Core overpowers her.
We're not goin' back. Even El Reno's better than there.
Chris makes eye contact with Sam again. She maintains it a moment and then looks away.

Vietnam Tom explores a cluttered junkyard, gathering materials. He scours amongst the PILES OF REFUSE, RUSTY MACHINES and crumbling STORAGE SHACKS. He bends to pick up a SCRAP OF METAL and adds it to a collection he's making in a worn SATCHEL...

As Sam and Corey are about to enter the diner, Trudy Pott a bank teller, is on her way out. The girls move to the side so she can exit, and take noti of a MISSING PERSONS SIGN posted next to the door -- BILL MOORCROFT'S (10) dark, empty eyes stare at them from the BLACK & WHITE PHOTOGRAPH.
Isn't that just awful?
Trudy has stopped and is looking over their shoulders.
His poor mother...
The girls sit at a booth, sipping Cokes.
How much money do we have left?
Not a whole lot.
I can't believe your fucking parents wouldn't give you anything.
They totally flipped out that I was even going. They weren't about to give me money for the big trip.
We should've waited till the end of the month when my mom gets her check.
She wouldn't have given you anything.
I know where she keeps her cash. What's she gonna do, send her boyfriend after me?
Corey pokes at the crushed ice in her glass with her stra
Doesn't matter. As soon as we get to Vegas, we'll be set. My cousin said sometimes she makes two grand in a week.
Jesus.
Sam is impressed, but something about her subdued reactio exhibits reservations... Just then, Agatha Dowdy arrives plates of BURGERS AND FRIES.
Here you go. Where'd you two say you were from again?
Virginia.
You hear that, Ted?
She calls to Ted Moncton, who is busy behind the counter.
What?
These girls are from Virginia.
I'll be damned. I'm from Reedville, if you know where abouts that is...
Neither Sam nor Corey give much of a hint as to a yes or
Well, have yourself some ice cream when you're done, on the house. COREY                               SAM
Okay.                           Thank you.
Anything else you need, give a holler.

Agatha moves off, and Sam and Corey start to dig into the food... Momentarily, someone else enters and takes a seat at the counter by their booth. It's Jeremy Frame, the driver of BMW. He raises a finger to alert Ted of his presence.
Just a coffee, please.
Ted nods and pours him a cup... After he receives his cof Jeremy turns and stares at the girls. They both notice hi doing it, but Corey is the first to speak.
Can we help you?
No, no... it's just that I recognize you. I saw you by the motel. Pretty amazing, huh?
I guess.
I just made a deal with Frank Haley to buy it for seven-hundred fifty dollars.
Whoop-dee-doo. What the hell are you gonna do with a friggin' meteor?
Meteorite, actually...
Corey rolls her eyes at being corrected. Sam smirks and munches on a french fry -- she's enjoying their conversat
I'm gonna study it. I'm a grad student at Redlands... we've actually got a pretty cool geology lab there.
Corey focuses on her lunch, ignoring him, but Jeremy goes
I've gotta do some tests, but if I had to guess, I'd say it's a siderite. They're composed primarily of iron and nickel.
Have fun.
My name's Jeremy.
That's nice.
Sam glances up at Jeremy, expecting him to be hurt or embarrassed by Corey's snub. But he's not. He's smiling a her, and she can't help but smile back.

Each licking an ICE CREAM CONE, Corey and Sam walk past t home of Father Homeijer. The priest is outside working in flower garden, wearing his CLERICAL COLLAR. An old CATHOL CHURCH rests on the same lot as his house, looming behind When Father Homeijer sees the girls walking by, he rises his work, takes off his gloves and wipes sweat from his forehead. Sam and Corey both notice him eyeballing them.
What's his problem?
Just keep walking.
Corey waves to him in a sarcastic, exaggerated manner... priest doesn't wave back, but continues to gawk at them u they go around the corner.
Freak...
Vietnam Tom crouches in a decrepit SHACK covered by a pie of CORRUGATED ROOFING. He works with great focus, arrangi VARIOUS BITS OF METAL into some sort of small SCULPTURE..
Having finished their ice creams, the girls pass the liqu store on the way back to the motel. They find Randy, Ruth Jeff and Mike at their usual post.
Hey, what's up?
Not much... just getting stared down by creepy priest boy back there.
Father Homeijer?
Don't worry, you're a little old for his taste.
Yeah, he's a fuckin' perv.
(to Randy) You got an extra cigarette?
Randy takes a pack from his pocket and offers her one.
I'm throwin' a big party at my house tonight, you guys should come by. No excuses this time...
Sam and Corey look at each other, considering.
You're gonna be stuck in El Reno, you might as well have some fun, right?

The party at Randy's teems with LOCALS, ages ranging from early teens to late-20s. On the back deck is a KEG OF BEE and a BOOMBOX blasting MUSIC. There's a slimy-looking POO and a few people swim in the greenish water. Randy and Ruth make their rounds as a pair. They stop off Ruth can sell a BAG OF WEED to some eager KIDS. Corey and hang with Mike and Jeff, drinking beer.
You guys gotta come visit the club when we get all set up. We'll give you the VIP treatment, man...
Mike and Jeff are both excited about this proposition.
Sounds good to me.
Give us a little time, me and Sam'll be runnin' that place, no doubt... right?
Yeah. Definitely.

Corey is relaxed, enjoying their newfound friends, while appears more out of place. She drains the better part of cup for some liquid courage. Randy and Ruth converge back on the group just as Officer O'Dell creeps into the backyard wearing plainclothes. Rut notices him first.
Fuck.
What?
That pig, O'Dell.
Don't worry about Ryan. He might be a cop, but he still likes to party.
Randy's theory is proven when O'Dell takes a FLASK from h pocket and has a snort before approaching a pair of TEENA GIRLS... But Ruth is still not satisfied.
I think that asshole knows I deal. You know how fucked that is?
From what I hear he's got a little somethin' goin' on the side himself.
Fucking pig's a pig.
They're all distracted when somebody does a cannonball in the pool and splashes them. MIKE                               JEFF
Fuck!                            Bastard!
What the hell...
Sam bends to wipe some of the water from her pants. Ruth watches her, smirking.
We might as well all go in now, we're already wet.
Good idea...
Without warning, Ruth shoves Sam backwards into the pool

She sinks into the murky water in SLOW-MOTION. All SOUNDS DROWNED OUT and everything is tranquil, completely detach Through her blurred vision, Sam can see Randy's PORCH LIG glimmering beyond the surface of the water... TRANSITION

The SPOT LIGHTS are blinding from the perspective of the STAGE. Through the WHITE BLUR an auditorium full of PEOPL can been seen... In SLOW-MOTION and perfect synchronicity, YOUNG SAMANTHA and the "SPARKLE MOTION" GIRLS are in the midst of their dance performance... BACK TO:

A HAND reaches into the pool, grabs onto Sam's arm and pu her up -- She breaches the surface of the water, gasping for breath back to reality. She sees that Randy is the one responsib for pulling her out.
You fall asleep down there?

He, Ruth and the others are looking down at her, laughing Sam is lost in thought, struck by her vision... She snaps out of it when she sees Corey tear off her top jump into the pool beside her. Many of the PARTYGOERS hoo approval, and Randy, Mike and Jeff strip down and leap in right behind her. Sam swims toward the far side of the pool where the steps are, and fewer people. When she arrives there, she's surprised to find Chris Holt waiting for her with a towel
Thought you could maybe use this.

As Chris hands her the towel, he notices a wide SCAR on t inside of Sam's RIGHT WRIST... but doesn't mention it. Sa wraps the towel around her sopping wet body. Corey looks over and sees her getting out...
Chris and Sam stand by the keg with fresh beers.
So what's so wrong at home that you had to take off?
The question takes Sam by surprise.
I'd love to get outta here someday too... just don't know quite where I'd go.
Sam decides to open up a little.
I hate it there. It's like everyone knows everything about me, but I'm invisible at the same time. It's like the worst of both worlds.
Small towns. How `bout your family?
They didn't want me to leave... well, they did, but they wanted me to go away to Harvard or something like that, like my sister.
Sam takes a big sip of her beer, showing signs of tipsine
Sometimes I think it would've been easier if... I just, after my BROTHER-
Sam stops herself.
What?
(changing gears) That's why I love Corey, she just doesn't give a shit. She does what she wants and she doesn't care what people think.
You just gotta be yourself, that's all. What is it you wanna do exactly?
I always thought I'd be a dancer, like in a troupe or something...
Sam is self-conscious after admitting this.
That sounds kinda stupid probably.
No...
When I was younger, my dance team was on Star Search.
Really?
Yeah... but I didn't go.
Why not?
I didn't end up dancing in the talent show where they got discovered... I didn't really feel like it at the time anyway.
Huh...
But that's why we're going to Vegas. There's lots of opportunities there.
Chris glances over to the pool where Corey is topless, splashing and goofing around with some BOYS.
(SMIRKING) Yeah, good place for it. Gettin' some practice on the way, too.
Sam takes offense, getting drunk and sensitive.
Is that supposed to be like some kind of judgement or something?
No, I was just-
She takes her beer and storms away from him.
Sam, wait... hey, come on...

Sam finds a STOOP at the side of the house where she can alone. She can HEAR the PARTY going on in the backyard, b no one else is in sight. Still soaking wet, she plants herself on the stoop and st to pound the rest of her drink... A strange, abrupt HARD CUT TO:

location: STREET IN FRONT OF RANDY'S HOUSE

text: Sam lies in the middle of the street in front of Randy's. lone, flickering STREET LIGHT intermittently bathes her i orange glow. She is completely dry, wearing her HOODED SWEATSHIRT and JEANS, with the MAKESHIFT BANDAGE wrapped around her righ hand. The SHARD OF METAL protrudes from the GASH in her forehead... A CAR suddenly screams right past her prostrate form, mis her by inches. She sits up slowly and looks toward the fr of Randy's house, which is about 20 yards away.

Two DRUNK GUYS exit the house and enter the complex, phosphorescent grid that is Sam's field of vision. VECTOR SPEARS jut from their chests and precede all their moveme as they open the gas tank of a PARKED CAR, insert a SIPHO and begin to drain the gas into ANOTHER VEHICLE.
Hurry up...

Although she is close by, they take no notice of Sam whatsoever. ANOTHER CAR speeds by, again nearly crushing but she doesn't flinch... She stands, and turns deliberately to face the opposite s of the road where, unlike the Drunk Guys, there is someon who is completely focused on her -- Vietnam Tom crouches DITCH near a CULVERT --
Sam appears with him in the tenebrous ditch. Tom stares a her wide-eyed through the eyeholes of his ski mask.

From one end of the broad, open culvert they can see stra through to the other side... A PORTAL starts to take shape within, swirling around the circumference. Soft, BLUE LIGHT touches their faces from phosphorescent glow, and a gust of WIND is nearly strong enough to make them falter. On the opposite end of the culvert, a PLATE OF WHITE LIGH flashes for an instant then transforms into an image of
Tom and Sam stand outside the church. The STEEPLE reigns them. Sam is stoic as she watches Tom climb the STONE STE and approach the great WOOD DOORS...

Sam sits like a statue in one of the PEWS. Tom strides pa her in a daze, moving toward the PULPIT... Beside the ALTAR stand THREE BARE CROSSES in imitation of Calvary, each standing over 4 feet tall. Sam looks up to a HIGH CORNER, above the pulpit to the ri where two walls and the ceiling meet...

The three planes come together at an irregular angle, wit the WALL ON THE RIGHT SIDE SLANTING INWARD, and the CEILI SLOPING SLIGHTLY DOWNWARD. PHOSPHORESCENCE burns in the three queerly pitches lines, with a concentration of heightened energy at the juncture A VECTOR SPEAR bulges from Vietnam Tom's chest where he stands below it, reaching higher and higher... As Tom's SPEAR gets closer to the convergence point, the BIZARRE ANGLING becomes more exaggerated because the plan start to DIP and SWELL with impossible elasticity --
Sam and Tom find themselves squeezed between the inner an outer walls. Claustrophobic, dusty and obscure.

Dilapidated WIRING snakes around them, and Tom barely has enough space to reach forth and touch it with his finger. COSMIC ENERGY jolts through the WIRE. A SPARK. A BLUE FLAME... Heat and pressure build. The old dry wood begins to CREAK SNAP -- FADE TO WHITE. OVER WHITE... The SHARP SOUNDS echo and fade away... then become presen again. Louder now, and different. A BANGING...

Sam pulls back the CURTAIN OF WHITE -- a SHEET over her f She's lying on the floor of the motel room in between the beds. She's alone, and naked except for the sheet. Her WET CLOT are in a heap beside her. Her head is throbbing...
She scrambles to put something on so she can get the DOOR
Having thrown on some wrinkled clothes, Sam opens the doo find Phil, the motel owner. He does not look pleased.
You plannin' on checkin' out today?
(GROGGY) Uh... I, I don't know yet.
Well, it's already way past checkout time, so you'd better figure it out quick.
I've just gotta find Corey... and check on the car.
You do whatever you have to, but if you're stayin' another night I wanna see some money up front.

Sam approaches the bank, and when she sees the tall SIGN the digital clock, she stops and stares up at it. It stri a chord but she doesn't know why... The sign reads 12:48 PM -- and then -- JUNE 20, 1995. It changes to the FIREWORKS COUNTDOWN: 14 DAYS, 8 HOURS, 11 MINUTES, 22 SECONDS... 21 SECONDS...
Sam enters the small bank, and as she approaches the coun she sees that Trudy Potter is in tears. Some of her FEMAL WORKERS are consoling her.
I don't believe it... I still just don't believe it.
It's gonna be alright. You'll see.
Trudy looks up and sees Sam waiting uncomfortably.
(dabbing at her eyes with a tissue) Can I help you?
Is everything okay?
No, it's not... Mount Calvary burned to the ground last night.
Mount Calvary?
Father Homeijer's church.
Oh... How did it happen?
The police are looking into it, but... I know it was arson.
Trudy leans in to talk quietly to Sam.

It's no secret to me how people in this town feel about Father Homeijer. The horrible accusations that have been made against him... But it's just a lot of nonsense. El Reno's changed so much since I was a kid growing up here. The young people nowadays... (BEAT) No offense.
She places her hand on top of Sam's.
But with all the drugs and the crime... I just don't know what this world's coming to anymore.
Sam tries to redirect her focus.
Are you able to get money wired here from my bank back home?
We don't usually work with other banks like that.
I need to check my balance and get my money out. How do I do that?
You'll have to call and arrange it. You could always use Western Union. Where's your bank?
Virginia.
Oh... `cause they're gonna need to have a signature.
Disappointed, Sam turns to leave...

As she's on her way out, she notices a BULLETIN BOARD wit another MISSING PERSONS SIGN for BILLY MOORCROFT. She stands before the picture, staring into the young boy dark, empty eyes. Though it's just a low quality black & white photo, Billy's face emotes profound hopelessness an despair.
As Sam comes out of the bank Jeremy rolls up in his BMW a parks in the lot. He gets out and approaches her.
Hi there.
Hey.
I didn't get your name at the diner.
I'm Sam.
Jeremy.
They shake, and Jeremy holds her hand for a little longer than what is generally comfortable.
So what are you up to?
Trying to get money... not very successfully.
I've gotta pick up some cash too. Need some supplies for the lab. I don't think I've even slept since I got my hands on that meteorite. You should come by the lab with me and check it out.
I can't...
Sam starts to walk away from him.
I could let you borrow some money... if you need some.
I don't even know you.
That's okay. I trust you.
Thanks anyway.
You're sure you don't want to check out the lab?
Sorry... I've gotta find Corey.
Sam turns to leave.
Maybe some other time.

Corey rides shotgun in Randy's car, chewing on some greas FAST FOOD, looking quite content. Randy is behind the whe with a BEER in his hand, and Mike, Jeff and Ruth are pack into the back, passing around a JOINT.
How many cheeseburgers did we get?
Like eight.
Mike passes the joint up to Corey and she takes a big hit chases it with some beer...
Wait, did we get smokes?
Everyone in the car is stunned into momentary silence whe they turn a corner and see what's left of the church. MIKE                            RANDY
Whoa!                           Jesus Christ...

POLICE and FIREMEN swarm. Father Homeijer stands with Off O'Dell, gazing at the soggy ruins. The only things standi amid the charred mess are the THREE BARE CROSSES of Mount Calvary. But they aren't completely intact --
All three are bent drastically forward, sagging down towa the murky ground...
Musta' melted from the heat.
Father Homeijer looks down at the metamorphosis, beside himself with bitterness and sorrow.
They're made of silver-plated steel. A simple fire couldn't do that.
What are you sayin'?
This is an extension of Satan's own hand... I've seen it coming.
Rolling his eyes, O'Dell walks away, leaving the priest t grieve for his church in private.

Vietnam Tom continues to toil over his SCULPTURE, but progress has been made... It has begun to take on a recognizable form: a GROTESQUE COUNTENANCE with TWO LONG EARS, BULGING EYES and a devili TOOTHY GRIN...

location: RANDY'S CAR/STREET IN FRONT OF DEPARTMENT STORE -

text: Sam is walking in front of a DEPARTMENT STORE when Randy' car pulls up beside her. Corey sticks her head out the passenger side window.
What happened to you?
What happened to me...? Where the hell've you been?
I crashed at Randy's. We just got food. Want a burger?
My stomach's fucked up. JEFF                             MIKE
Awww...                         Poor tummy... Jeff and Mike taunt her from the back. Ruth leers.
We gotta talk about what we're gonna do.
Don't worry about it so much.
The motel guy came to the room this morning all pissed off. We're probably not even gonna have enough money to pay for the car.

Corey sighs, debating weather or not to get out. Before s can reach a decision, something in the department store's parking lot catches her eye: a LITTLE BOY with dark hair, wearing a BIRTHDAY HAT... But she blinks and he's gone, having disappeared between parked vehicles. Confused, Corey rubs her eyes and gets out of the car.
Should I wait a minute?
We gotta get some smokes...
Just go ahead. I'll catch up with you later on.
Alright. Later.
Corey gets out and shuts the door. Randy speeds off towar intersection about 20 yards ahead...
Chris is at work, stocking shelves inside the department store... He checks his watch, stops what he's doing and grabs a PA OF CIGARETTES from his breast pocket -- time for a smoke break.
Sam and Corey meander toward the intersection where Randy car is stopped at a red light.
We just gotta figure out what we're gonna do. I don't think-
(ABRUPT) Lemme guess, you wanna go home.
What?
You wanna run back to mommy and daddy and say sorry so they can put you through college. Well that's real big of you, Sam, but I don't have that option.
(taken aback) What are you talking about?
I'll go home and get the shit kicked out of me, and get my ass grabbed by my mom's boyfriend...
They're almost to the light, which is still red, and comi up on Randy's car. Jeff, Mike and Ruth stare out at them the backseat, smelling the drama.
I knew you'd bail on me eventually, but not this quick.
I'm not bailing on you. Would you JUST-
You can fucking sleepwalk back to Middlesex for all I care. I'm not driving you... you're a fucking drag.
The light turns green, and Randy's car peels across the intersection, making a left...
Fuck you, Corey.

Sam wheels on her and steps out into the street, storming straight across. Corey starts to follow... but something stops her in her tracks: BILLY MOORCROFT. He stands on the opposite side of the intersection, in th trajectory that Sam is walking -- but Sam doesn't see him Billy wears a BIRTHDAY HAT, SLACKS and COLLARED SHIRT. He looks pale and weak, and is covered with BRUISES. He star right back at Corey, as transfixed as she is... TIME SLOW DOWN. [Note: Sam's position is in the middle of the road. Randy's car has made the left but is still in the vicinit the intersection.] Bewildered, Corey tries to step out into the street but something blocks her -- an invisible FORCE FIELD makes forward progress impossible. RIPPLES swell like waves throughout the barrier where she it. She looks up, following the ripples with her eyes, an watches as they disappear beyond her realm of vision, int infinite space. She reaches forth with her hand, wanting to feel the barr once again... Just as she touches it... REAL TIME RESUMES

head_text.subj: FROM OUT OF NOWHERE AN OLD JALOPY SAILS RIGHT IN FRONT

text: RANDY'S CAR! He jerks the wheel -- and the JALOPY hits on front passenger side -- completely smashing it in -- Sam spins when she HEARS the deafening CRUNCH... Randy careens into the opposite lane, and an ONCOMING CAR smacks him dead on. The inertia from the oncoming vehicle plows his car into a FIRE HYDRANT by the side of the road The hydrant goes flying through the air like a bullet --

head_text.subj: -- AND STRIKES SAM RIGHT IN THE HEAD

text: The world goes SILENT.

head_text.subj: CHRIS RUNS TOWARD THE DESTRUCTION, DROPPING HIS CIGARETTE
WATER ERUPTS LIKE A GEYSER FROM THE PIPE WHERE THE HYDRAN
SAM'S BODY IS CRUMPLED IN THE STREET, MOTIONLESS...
BILLY MOORCROFT IS GONE. THE FORCE FIELD IS GONE. COREY
STANDS FROZEN, HORRIFIED... IN UTTER SHOCK.

text: Corey signs her STATEMENT on Officer O'Dell's desk, the expression of shock still glued to her face. O'Dell sits facing her.
You're sure you didn't see a driver?
No...
He takes the statement from her.
Well, you're one lucky girl to have gotten outta the car when you did. Front passenger side was wiped right out. Coulda' been two dead girls today instead of one.
Corey nods, taking this in.
I talked to Randy and sent him home a little while ago. He's pretty shook up.
Corey doesn't respond. O'Dell leans in to speak to her in confidence.
Both of us know he'd been doin' some drinkin' today. But we also know he's not at fault here. That old beater cut right in front him.
Can't you just look up the license plates?
No plates on the vehicle. We're investigating the VIN, but that could take a little more time, depending on the history of ownership. We'll find him.
Corey seems somewhat hesitant to bring up the next subjec
What about the missing boy?
O'Dell shifts in his chair.
You really think it was him, huh?
He was on the side of the road right before the accident.
I'm no psychiatrist, but I do know sometimes shock does funny things...
You think I was hallucinating?
We were on the scene five minutes after the accident. I think somebody woulda noticed a little boy wandering around.
He sees how troubled Corey is.
Why don't you stop in and see Dr. Peters on your way out... right down the hall there. She'll give you somethin' to make you feel better.
Corey nods and gets up to leave. As she's on her way out, O'Dell's voice stops her.
Oh, uh... is there anything you wanted to say to Samantha's parents?
Corey's expression is blank.
Like what?

Corey walks out of the police station and finds herself i secluded back parking lot. She holds a PRESCRIPTION for a depressants. She is frightened when she notices a PAIR OF EYES staring her from the bushes close by -- it's Vietnam Tom. He's wearing his ski mask and he's got his rifle. Corey backs away as Tom slowly creeps toward her... She's about to scream for help when Chris Holt comes out of the police station behind her.
Get the hell outta here.
Grateful for his presence, Corey moves to stand behind Ch Tom shuffles away.
Should know better than to be carrying his rifle around town like that...
Corey takes a breath, recovering from her scare.
You okay?
What're you doing here?
I had to put in a statement too. Can I give you a lift?
Chris and Corey pull up to the motel in his pick-up. They gotten Corey's prescription filled, and she has the BOTTL PILLS in her hand.
I'm real sorry about Sam.
Corey nods.
It's such a waste. Just a horrible, freak thing.
I said some pretty shitty things to her right before it happened.
I'm sure she knew you didn't mean it.
Corey gets out of the car and walks toward the motel room

Corey swallows two of her PILLS with some liquor from a plastic cup. She sits down on one of the full-size beds w Sam's belongings are spread out. She opens Sam's backpack and discovers THE PHILOSOPHY OF TRAVEL book, by Roberta Sparrow... As Corey studies the cover, her image is reflected by the CLOSET DOOR MIRRORS. The angle of the mirrors creates dou image reflections for other objects in the room. Strangel Corey's reflection is only present in one of the panes. The digital CLOCK/RADIO shows 6:30 PM... There are PICTURES of Sam's family tucked away inside the book, between the pages: Sam with her mother and father, and EDDIE DARKO; YOUNG SAM with ELIZABETH and DONNIE; an photo of the whole Darko family together -- Young Sam hol ARIEL, a STUFFED TOY UNICORN. Corey removes the pictures and sets them on the nightstan She then looks down and notices that the book is open to: CHAPTER THREE - THE FRAGMENTARY UNIVERSE.
Fragmentary Universe...

She pours over the text, some of which reads: When the fa of the fourth dimension within a Tangent Universe becomes corrupted, a highly unstable and volatile Fragmentary Universe can occur, sustaining itself for no longer than several days... FADE TO BLACK.
Corey awakens to the sound of a little boy CRYING. She si up in bed. The clock/radio reads 3:30 AM. The CRYING is f but steady and sorrowful, and sounds as though it's comin from outside...

Corey follows the distinctive CRYING toward the VENDING MACHINES on the side of the building... ...until Billy Moorcroft emerges from behind them. Corey freezes a few feet away from the boy, who wears the BIRTH HAT, SLACKS and COLLARED SHIRT. He is pale and bruised. Corey sees that he is not crying -- it's coming from elsewhere in the cosmos, far away. The WAILS taper off to faint, DISTORTED WHISPER as Billy speaks:
You need to save me, Corey.
Corey stares at him in disbelief.
You need to save me... and save the world.
Why can't anyone see you?
If you tell them about me they'll think you're a dummy.
Why me?
I didn't pick you. Just like you didn't pick me either.
Corey stands before him in awe, transfixed.
We shouldn't even be here. Nobody should...

Corey takes notice of the vending machines behind him. Wh the prices should be, NUMBERS flash in a rhythm that seem coincide with the ululations of the distant CRYING: 2... 10... 16... 44... -end-... 2... 10... 16... 44... -end-..
You don't have much time.
Corey is about to respond when the sound of a DOOR OPENIN stops her. The FLASHING NUMBERS on the vending machines g back to normal PRICES, the CRYING SOUND CEASES, and Billy disappears.
What's goin' on out here?
Corey looks over and sees Phil dressed in nightclothes, having come out of a room near the lobby. She's dumbstruc
Nothing... I-I don't know.
Go back to your room and get some sleep. You've had a tough day.
Phil goes back inside, leaving her alone.
Corey wanders through the aisles of the department store, looking peaked and jittery. She comes upon Chris stocking some shelves near the back of the store.
Hey... how ya feelin'?
Not so good.
Is there anything I can do?
I need some cigarettes... and maybe some food. But I don't really have any money right now.
I'm off at 3:30. Meet me out behind the store.
Corey waits on the cement steps by the loading dock. She shoots up when Chris comes out the back entrance with a PLASTIC BAG...
Corey takes it from him and looks inside: CANDY BARS, a B OF CHIPS, some PEANUTS, a pack of CIGARETTES.
Thanks.
She tears open the cigarettes and lights one. Chris light one of his own, and notices Corey's hands are shaking.
Shouldn't you go back home?
There's nothing for me to go home to. Trust me.
What about Sam's funeral?
Corey looks conflicted, but she takes a harsh stance:
What's the point? She's gone, that's it. Nothing's gonna change that...
Chris lets it go.
Is there a library around here?
(PUZZLED) Yeah... you need a book?
Is it walking distance?
I can take you.
I think I'd rather walk.
Corey and Chris stroll together along a quiet street.
So you guys were real close, huh.
When I moved to Virginia Sam was like the only person I could even stand to talk to.
How long had you been plannin' your trip together?
Not too long... kind of a last minute thing. It was good timing, `cause I don't like to stay in one place for too long, ya know?
Huh...
I was really surprised when Sam wanted to come, actually. I just kinda brought it up one day, and she was down...
Corey reflects for a beat.
If it wasn't for me, she'd still be alive right now.
You can't think like that.
It's true, isn't it?
Chris doesn't respond.
Corey and Chris sit before a screen in a cramped, dim boo near the back of the library. They stare at a MICROFILM ARTICLE from 1988 about DONNIE DARKO'S DEATH.
That was Sam's brother?
Yeah.
On the screen is a PHOTOGRAPH of the DARKO HOUSE with man PEOPLE gathered in front of it. A JET ENGINE is being lif away by a CRANE.
Her parents must be going through hell.
Sam said once she wished it landed on her room instead of Donnie's.
Chris thinks on this.
I saw something on Sam's wrist the other night... it looked like a scar.
She told me it was from some accident. Put her hand through a window or something.
Did you believe her?

Corey doesn't answer. She pulls up ANOTHER ARTICLE, one t chronicles a MAN who was IMPALED BY A METAL PIPE with no known origin... A THIRD ARTICLE is about a LITTLE GIRL who was DECAPITATE A MANHOLE COVER that was inexplicably flying through the air...
God...

Chris is horrified. Corey is totally engrossed. She brings up a FINAL ARTICLE that tells the story of a B who was CRUSHED BY A DUMPSTER that fell from the sky. A PICTURE shows his legs sticking out from under it like th Wicked Witch of the East when Dorothy's house fell on her Munchkinland.
I don't understand why we're lookin' at this stuff.
They still never found a driver to that car that hit Randy... I was standing right there. I didn't see anyone.
I was pretty close too, but everything was all crazy. Whoever it was must've jumped out and took off.

I found this book in Sam's backpack last night. There's a chapter where it talks about stuff like this happening. Like a guy being killed by an arrow that nobody shot, and a swordsmith getting killed by a sword he hadn't made yet. Unexplainable things, but it says there's a reason why they happen.
A book...? I don't get what your talkin' about. What was the reason?
It didn't say.
Corey thinks, trying to figure out the right way to expre something...
Last night, and right before the accident, I saw...
What?
Nothing.
Corey sighs and turns back to the screen.
You already think I'm a freak show.

As Chris and Corey are on the way out, they notice Jeremy Frame at the counter checking out a STACK OF BOOKS. In putting them down, he accidentally drops half of them the floor. He looks frazzled as he begins to pick them up and he scratches compulsively at his LEFT FOREARM...

Chris and Corey pull up to Dusty's auto repair shop in Ch truck. They get out and start to walk up to the garage, but they cut off by the unchained PIT BULL -- it's growling and barking in a frenzy --
Darielle!
The dog heels at the sound of the voice, and Ruth bolts o of the house and takes her by the collar. She's got a ban over a cut on her forehead.
Come to check on your car?
Yeah...
Hearts still thumping in their chests, they follow Ruth i the garage... COREY'S CHEVROLET is parked in the same spo was when she left it the other day. The hood is propped o
Randy's been a wreck since the accident.
He should be. He was driving around shit-faced and somebody got killed.
You can just fuck off...
She gets right up in his face with such intensity that Ch retreats a step or two.
Prima donna motherfucker think your shit don't stink?
Corey steps in:
She's right...
Chris gives her a look.
I mean, there's nothing Randy could've done.
Ruth turns and goes into the house through a GARAGE ENTRA
I'll get my dad.
The door slams shut behind her, and Corey and Chris glanc each other... Momentarily, Dusty comes out, a partially eaten SANDWICH hand.
Got some bad news for you...
He walks them over to the car, finishing off his sandwich wiping his hands on his greasy jeans.
Your engine seized up when your water pump blew.
I need a new engine now?
I can get one in there for you. Cost you about fifteen hundred.
Corey's face drops.
I don't have anywhere near that much money.
That's probably as much as the car's worth.
I understand. But, I already ordered the water pump, and I'll have to get paid for my time. That comes to about three-hundred total.
I don't have that much either.
Dusty is perturbed.
You think I do this for charity?
You didn't do anything. What's she want a water pump for if she doesn't have an engine?
I see how it is... couple a' punks. You don't plan to pay what you owe, you can get the hell off my property right now.
Corey glares at him, furious, but Chris takes her by the
(under her breath) Asshole.
Let's go...

Chris' truck pulls up in front of the motel and parks. At same time, Father Homeijer and Trudy come out of the FRON OFFICE carrying a COLLECTIONS JAR. As they approach the truck Chris slowly rolls down the window.
Good afternoon.
We're taking collections to help rebuild Mount Calvary after the tragic fire.
Any small amount you could manage would really help.
Sorry.
Father Homeijer and Trudy look over to Corey in the passe seat but she just stares back at them.
God bless you.
They turn and walk away, and Chris rolls his window back
Everybody wants somethin'...
What about you?
What do you mean?
You wouldn't give me stuff and drive me around if you didn't want something in return.
Why not?
`Cause that's just not how it works.
Maybe you're wrong about that.
Corey nods, but still doesn't believe him.
See ya.
She gets out, and Chris eyes her as she walks to her room

Corey lays on her stomach in bed, her head buried in The Philosophy of Time Travel book. The TELEVISION is on in t b.g. (out of focus), playing a repeat of the FOREMAN GRIL INFOMERCIAL... Suddenly, there is a slight TREMOR from outside and RIPPL runs over the TV screen. Corey looks around, taking no notice of the odd change on television -- instead of GEORGE FOREMAN'S VOICE, HULK HOG is HEARD promoting the brand new HULKSTER GRILL... Just then, there is a KNOCK at the door. She gets up to answer it and finds Randy -- he looks distraught.
Do you hate me?
Huh?
You think it's my fault she's dead.
No...
You mean it?
Yeah... it wasn't your fault.
Randy sighs as if a big weight has been lifted.
What's that?
Corey looks down and realizes that she's still holding Th Philosophy of Time Travel book in her hand.
Oh, it's just... something of Sam's.
Randy nods. Corey tosses the book onto the bed.
You wanna get outta here for a while? I got my dad's car.

RANDY'S DAD'S CAR navigates a DIRT ROAD up a WOODED HILL VANTAGE POINT where the whole of El Reno can be seen. SPA LIGHTS flicker over about 80 square miles of civilization There are a few OTHER VEHICLES parked at the lookout, mos containing COUPLES with MUSIC playing low. Randy pulls into a more SECLUDED CLEARING, away from the other cars but still with a nice view.
I've been comin' up here since I was a kid. Good place when you wanna just get away from everything.
Randy pushes in a TAPE (suggestion: River of Deceit, by M Season), then takes a JOINT from his pocket and sparks it
Is Ruth your girlfriend?
Randy passes the joint to Corey and she hits it.
Naw, we're just friends. She's pretty weird sometimes. Too like... intense, or something.
Seems like you guys are pretty close.
Yeah... don't worry about Ruth.
Randy takes another hit and holds it in.
Do you ever have a hard time telling what's real and what's not real?
Randy exhales and looks over at her, perplexed.
Sometimes... sometimes something can feel really real, but it's just your mind playing tricks on you.
I've got so much shit in my head right now... I've never felt so outta control. I think I'm really goin' psycho.
He passes her the joint.

I got some acid from my buddy one time... this like flying eagle pyramid shit. I took two hits, and man... next thing I knew I was on the floor, curled up in ball, and Mike and Jeff were just standing there lookin' down at me. I could see this like glowing grid cutting through my brain, and I knew when it got all the way through I'd be this sketched out vegetable. I could picture my dad staring down at me in the hospital in my straightjacket, crying and shit...
Corey blows out a hit, captivated...
The whole time my esophagus was like twisting and turning in my throat and cutting off my air supply... it was terrible.
Jesus.

I can still slip back into it sometimes, but I know now that my brain is what's making it real... and that's like a blessing and a curse, man, `cause that means you have to decide what's real and what's not.
The things that feel the most real right now are... impossible. More like a dream.
Corey passes him the joint and he stamps out the roach in car's ashtray.
I know what you mean. The scariest part is thinking you're not the same person anymore. Something's changed... like your identity.
What if the change is for the better?
Randy finds an INHALER in his pocket and takes a puff.
That's fucked up.
I don't think I even care if I'm crazy.
Corey turns and looks into his eyes. Randy leans forward. They're about to kiss, when --
What the fuck?
A DARK SHAPE scurries to an enclosed area at the edge of forest where there's a TARP, some WATER BOTTLES, CANS OF and a RIFLE...
It's Vietnam Tom, and he's brought some supplies to his N SQUATTING GROUND.
That fucking guy again...
Randy and Corey both laugh, relieving the tension. But To proximity has spoiled the mood.
Let's get outta here.

Mike, Jeff and Ruth sit on a ratty couch in Randy's livin room, watching BEAVIS AND BUTT-HEAD on MTV. Some EMPTY BE CANS and a HOMEADE BONG litter a coffee table. When the F DOOR OPENS and Corey and Randy enter, none of them budge. As Corey and Randy walk to Randy's bedroom, Ruth follows with her eyes...

Randy shuts the door to his messy room. A TAPESTRY hangs the ceiling. Corey is drawn to a DESK next to the bed. Ab it is a DEATH SHRINE to KURT COBAIN -- MAGAZINE CUTOUTS, POSTERS and TICKET STUBS arranged decoratively. A large BLACK & WHITE POSTER showing a CLOSE   UP of COBA FACE is the centerpiece, and a sloppy BULLET   HOLE drawn RED MARKER marks the center of his forehead.   The words NOT AFRAID OF DYING' are scrawled across the   bottom of poster in the same BRIGHT RED.
This is cool.
Thanks.
Randy puts his hands on her hips, running them up her tor Corey turns to face him... They kiss... ...and fall back onto the bed...

A DIGITAL CLOCK on Randy's DESK shows 3:30 AM. There's a SLIGHT TREMOR and the numbers shift, changing briefly to 01:10:23:08, then back again to 3:30. Corey wakes suddenly from a nightmare. She sits up and lo around, remembering where she is. She discovers Randy asl by her side. She finds a pile of clothes on the floor bes the bed and grabs her shirt... ...after she pulls it on over her head, she freezes -- because Billy Moorcroft is standing right there in his BIRTHDAY HAT, staring at her.
Only one day left.
Corey turns and looks down to Randy. He's still fast asle
What am I supposed to do?

As soon as she utters her question she notices a silvery, liquid VECTOR SPEAR protruding from the center of her che Billy is now gone, but her SPEAR beckons her out of the r elongating to illustrate her path. Corey is in awe...

Her SPEAR leads her through the living room, and past the sleeping bodies of Mike, Jeff and Ruth. Following her pat leads her to step on RUTH'S FOOT as she goes by... Corey doesn't even notice, but one of Ruth's eyes pop ope she treads out the door...

Corey follows Billy, who walks in the middle of the road about 15 yards ahead of her. The residential street is guarded by great, OLD TREES on either side. The dark sky above starts to BEND and WARP, and a BUCKLE space-time materializes. There's a simultaneous flash of LIGHTING and sharp CRACK THUNDER, and Corey looks up to the VORTEX -- a massive, swirling MAELSTROM gapes open like a tunnel to the inter- dimensional realm of darkest night.

The VOID brightens, and ominous STORM CLOUDS and TORRENTI RAINS are visible within... Corey peers up into the MOUTH of it and sees DUSTY'S HOUS AND AUTO REPAIR SHOP being doused and beaten by the STORM

In contrast to the street, all is nearly SILENT in Dusty' garage. Corey watches as Billy moves along the perimeter WITHOUT SOUND, ghostly... JUMP CUTS and TIME CUTS. Her CHEVROLET sits in the bay. Some of the PARTS have alr been harvested -- the CATALYTIC CONVERTER sits next to it the floor. Corey approaches a UTILITY SINK next to a SHOWER in the corner...
You can do it.
How?
It's easy.

Corey focuses on the sink, and it begins to tremble. The pipes beneath it CREAK and MOAN. WATER starts to bubble u from the sink drain, also in the shower... Billy stands atop her car, watching her. His perpetually morose expression transforms into a smile. The SINK BASIN suddenly cracks from pressure. As Corey st into the drain... WE PLUNGE DOWN INTO THE PIPE --
We travel through meters and meters of DANK PIPING until hit the WATER MAIN. There's a sound like a TIDAL WAVE
-- WATER POURS out from under the garage door down to the street. PULL BACK TO REVEAL --
The entire driveway and the street in front of the house covered with water. FIRE TRUCKS, POLICE CARS and an AMBUL are gathered in front of the property.

Ruth runs toward her house. When she turns a corner and i comes into view, she stops dead in her tracks. Her face s sheer terror -- Because her father Dusty is handcuffed and being loaded i the back of a cruiser by Officer O'Dell and another policeman, OFFICER HINES... ...the PIT BULL struggles against it's CHAIN, growling an barking frantically. ...and Billy Moorcroft, half-naked, soaking wet and shivering, is wrapped in a blanket and being tended to by PARAMEDICS.
Lucky I heard him screamin', else he woulda drowned down there.
Ruth keeps to the shadows and slinks toward a BACK DOOR..

location: DUSTY'S HOUSE, FOOT OF THE STAIRS

text: She sloshes through four inches of water and skips up the stairs...
Without turning on the lights, Ruth desperately rifles through her closet until she finds a SHOEBOX. Inside it are several PLASTIC BAGS -- some filled with MARIJUANA, others with COCAINE...
Hands shaking, Ruth dumps a bag of coke into the toilet a flushes it. The WHITE POWDER disappears down the swirling SPIRAL OF CLOUDY LIQUID... But the bowl doesn't refill.
Shit!
She begins to stuff the other bags down her pants...
Having deposited Dusty in the back of the cruiser and shu the door, O'Dell's attention turns to an upstairs window the house when he sees MOVEMENT.
Randy rolls over in bed, opening his eyes to the new day. looks around for Corey, disappointed to find her gone.
Corey walks down an aisle of the department store. She fi Chris assisting a CUSTOMER.
I just checked aisle three.
They're there. At the front, by the Trapper Keepers.
The Customer moves off and Chris turns to find Corey stan beside him.
I'm outta cigarettes.
Corey waits behind the store until Chris comes out. She eagerly accepts TWO PACKS.
D'ya hear the news?
What?
They found that Billy Moorcroft kid. He was at Dusty's house...
Corey is floored.
Sick bastard had him locked up in the basement. I can't believe we were just over there yesterday.
Corey can't help it... A grin spreads across her face.
I guess he's gonna be okay-
Everything's gonna be okay.
Corey cuts him off, and Chris looks at her strangely.
I'm not crazy. I think everything's gonna be okay.

Corey lays on her stomach in bed, studying The Philosophy Time Travel. The book is open to: CHAPTER SIX - THE LIVIN RECEIVER... The Living Receiver is chosen to guide the Artifact into position for its journey back to the Primar Universe. No one knows how or why a Receiver will be chosen... She flips through the onion skin pages to: CHAPTER TEN - MANIPULATED DEAD... The Manipulated Dead are more powerfu than the Living Receiver. If a person dies within the Tan Dimension, they are able to contact the Living Receiver through the Fourth Dimensional Construct... Corey glances over at the CLOSET MIRROR and sees Billy's image reflected. She flips over and finds him standing at foot of the bed, clad in the same garb as all her visions
I already saved you.
It's not over.

He points to the CLOSET MIRROR... She stares into her own reflection as BILLY'S DISAPPEARS. HER IMAGE starts to FADE as well, and then the SURFACE OF MIRROR TRANSFORMS into a three-dimensional vision of a PA The focus is a SWING SET... and one of the SWINGS in particular, which rocks slowly back and forth. Empty. Voi life.
Why?

Inside Billy Moorcroft's quaint, sanitary-looking home is small gathering to celebrate his return. STREAMERS hang o a table supporting a partially eaten CAKE. A BANNER that reads `WELCOME HOME BILLY!' is draped across the archway connecting the DINING ROOM to the DEN. BILLY'S MOTHER (32), with her fair complexion and dark ha is an older female version of Billy himself. As she brings a POT OF COFFEE and a STACK OF CUPS into BILLY'S FATHER (35), BILLY'S AUNT and UNCLE, and a CHILD PSYCHOLOGIST who is moderating (50s; male) in the den, sh looks as though she's barely keeping it together.
(between bites of cake) The place for Billy to be right now is at home with his family...
Billy's Mother interrupts as she sets the coffee down.
Excuse me.
Oh, thank you.
The Psychologist accepts a cup.
It'll take years for him to work through what happened, but the best way to open those doors is to surround him with things that are familiar...
Billy's Mother passes her husband a cup, and they hold a long, painful moment of eye contact.
Billy sits at a table in the sunny, HEXAGONAL ROOM. He we the BIRTHDAY HAT, SLACKS and COLLARED SHIRT.

He appears clean and groomed, but his face and neck are marred by BRUISES and other ABRASIONS. Before him is a pa of COLORED PENCILS and some sheets of PAPER. His Mother walks up behind him, and peeks over his should at the DRAWING that he's working on.
Are you sure you don't want some more cake?
Billy nods. His mother caresses his head as she watches h color. After a moment she sits down in a chair beside him tries to get his attention.
Billy... I-
Before she can go on, she's interrupted by the DOORBELL. Billy never looks up.

head_text.subj: I/E. BILLY MOORCROFT'S HOUSE, FRONT DOOR

text: Billy's Father answers the door and finds Corey.
Only family and close friends are welcome here today.
Billy's Mother hovers behind her husband, curious about a wary of the stranger.

I understand... I just wanted to say that I'm sorry about everything that happened to Billy. And I know it doesn't seem like it, but everything happens for a reason... and it'll all work out in the end.
Billy's Father stares her down until she turns to leave uncomfortably. Billy's Mother starts to cry... CUT BACK T

...the breakfast nook. Billy is gone. Left on the table is his completed DRAWING. It's a neatly executed rendition of a SWING SET -- identical to the one from Corey's vision in the closet door mirror.

Billy walks through the empty park, still wearing his birthday hat. He makes his way past a SAND PIT with a JUN GYM. Balanced on one of the jungle gym's bars is a PRESCRIPTIO BOTTLE... Billy picks it up. The name on the prescription is COREY

The SWING SET. Billy leans back as far as he can as momen propels his body forward and back through space. He looks to the sky where SUPERNATURAL BLACK CLOUDS are forming... He swings back and forth... back and forth...

Corey sits nearby on a park bench, watching Billy. He loo back at her, showing no signs of recognition... JUMP CUT The SWING. No longer a little boy sitting in it. It dangl erratically from the ropes, still gripped by inertia... PAN DOWN to the sandy ground below -- FIND the bottle of pills, now empty. Billy's unmoving, OPEN HAND...
A TRACTOR-TRAILER TRUCK gets off the highway and heads in El Reno. It's load is a batch of beat up, OLD CARS. The JALOPY is on the TOP RACK, CLOSEST TO THE END...
Randy peeks in the window of Corey's motel room but sees nothing. He pounds on the door and calls for her:
Corey...
Corey arrives near the intersection where the accident to place. The BLACK CLOUDS overhead have become more vast an oppressive. A cold WIND blows...

The TRACTOR-TRAILER TRUCK breaches the crest of a hill an comes into view, descending on the intersection. Above it the CLOUDS begin to transform and take the shape an ASTRONOMICAL WORMHOLE that reaches down toward the earth...
Chris comes outside and gazes up at the foreboding sky...
As the TRACTOR-TRAILER TRUCK approaches the intersection, Corey fixates on the JALOPY on the back...
The CHAINS that hold the junker in place SHAKE and RATTLE
We plunge through the PORTAL as it twists through the ether...

The WORMHOLE extends down to the JALOPY. Gracefully. Like eel moving through water, confidently pursuing it's prey. mouth widening to swallow... Corey is riveted. As it passes through the intersection, the TRACTOR-TRAILE hits a POTHOLE -- CUT TO:

head_text.subj: PILLS COME OUT OF BILLY'S MOUTH AND INTO HIS HAND --
HIS DRAWING OF THE SWING SET STARTS TO DECONSTRUCT --
RUTH'S COCAINE FLIES OUT OF THE SWIRLING TOILET WATER --
DUSTY STEPS BACKWARDS OUT OF THE POLICE CRUISER --
COREY STEPS AWAY FROM THE KURT COBAIN POSTER WITH
AFRAID OF DYING' SCRAWLED ON IT --
PICTURES OF THE DARKO FAMILY ARE PUT BACK INTO THE PHILOS

location: RANDY'S CAR/STREET IN FRONT OF DEPARTMENT STORE -

text: Sam is walking in front of the department store when Rand car pulls up beside her. Corey sticks her head out the passenger side window.
What happened to you?
What happened to me...? Where the hell've you been?
I crashed at Randy's. We just got food. Want a burger?
My stomach's fucked up. JEFF                               MIKE
Awww...                           Poor tummy... Jeff and Mike taunt her from the back. Ruth leers.
We gotta talk about what we're gonna do.
Don't worry about it so much.
The motel guy came to the room this MORNING-
(INTERRUPTING) I don't give a fuck.
Excuse me?
I said, I. Don't. Give. A. Fuck...
She annunciates every word like a true bitch.
I'm tired of listening to you whine about everything.
Giggles from the peanut gallery in the car.
Corey, you're still drunk. Don't be a fuck-ass.
Did she just call her a fuck-ass?
What's a fuck-ass?
Everyone cracks up, including Corey. Sam is humiliated. S backs away from the car, anger burning in her eyes. Randy revs the engine, expressing his will to take off.
See ya later, Sam.
Sam says nothing, but watches as Randy's car peels off to the intersection. She's confused and hurt, frozen to the where she's standing. As Corey stares back at Sam from the car, her smile fades
Corey turns to face the approaching intersection. Resolut
Chris is at work, stocking shelves inside the department store... He checks his watch, stops what he's doing and grabs a PA OF CIGARETTES from his breast pocket -- time for a smoke break.

Randy's car is stopped at the red light. Sam strolls towa it ever so slowly. Jeff, Mike and Ruth gawk at her from t backseat. She slows down even more, having no interest in subjectin herself to any more of their mockery... The light turns green, and Randy's car peels across the intersection, making a left. Sam's still 10 or 15 feet aw from stepping into the street... She quickens her pace, almost there when --

head_text.subj: FROM OUT OF NOWHERE AN OLD JALOPY SAILS RIGHT IN FRONT

text: RANDY'S CAR! He jerks the wheel -- and the jalopy hits on front passenger side -- completely smashing it in -- Sam spins when she HEARS the deafening CRUNCH... Randy careens into the opposite lane, and an ONCOMING CAR smacks him dead on. The inertia from the oncoming vehicle plows his car into a FIRE HYDRANT by the side of the road The hydrant goes flying through the air like a bullet and skitters harmlessly across the intersection -- The world goes SILENT.

head_text.subj: CHRIS RUNS TOWARD THE DESTRUCTION, DROPPING HIS CIGARETTE
WATER ERUPTS LIKE A GEYSER FROM THE PIPE WHERE THE HYDRAN
THE JALOPY IS FLIPPED OVER ONTO ITS SIDE...
SAM STANDS PEERING AT THE WRECKAGE... THE AREA OF THE CAR
WHERE COREY WAS SITTING IS VIRTUALLY NONEXISTENT. SHE DRO

text: Sam signs her STATEMENT on Officer O'Dell's desk, her eye red and puffy from crying. O'Dell sits facing her.
I just gotta ask you one more time... you're sure you didn't see a driver?
Sam shakes her head no, and he takes the statement from h
Well, we'll find him, one way or another.
Sam nods in acknowledgement. O'Dell sees how much this ha traumatized her.
Why don't you stop in and see Dr. Peters on your way out... right down the hall there. She'll give you somethin' to make you feel better.

Sam walks out of the police station and finds herself in secluded back parking lot. She holds a PRESCRIPTION for a depressants... A pair of eyes peek out of the bushes close by -- it's Vietnam Tom. He's wearing his ski mask and he's got his rifle. He sees Sam, but she doesn't see him. Sam wells up with emotion, about to breakdown, and Tom watches her with empathy. It looks as though he's about t to her when something stops him -- Chris comes out the do
You okay?
Sam is still too choked up to speak. Tom sneaks away unnoticed...
Sam sits in the passenger side of Chris' truck and cries cries. Major emotional release. Chris looks like he wants to say something, but doesn't h the words.
Chris and Sam pull up to the motel in his pick-up. They'v gone to get her prescription filled, and Sam has the BOTT OF PILLS in her hand.
I'm really sorry, Sam.
She doesn't respond.
It's horrible... but sometimes these things can happen for a reason. Sometimes good can come of it... growth, ya know?
What the fuck are you talking about?
Sam's benumbed expression doesn't change, but her tone is caustic.
All I meant was, sometimes-

I know what you meant, and it's bullshit. When someone dies for no reason you can't just make one up to fill the void and make yourself feel better. It sucks, and it fucks everything up, but it doesn't mean shit beyond that.
I'm sorry, I-
You've obviously never lost anybody like I have, `cause if you did you'd already know that.
Chris doesn't try anymore. Sam immediately feels bad.
Thanks for the ride.
She gets out of the car and slogs toward her room.

Sam swallows her PILLS with some water, and sits down on of the full-size beds by her BACKPACK... She reaches inside and pulls out THE PHILOSOPHY OF TIME TRAVEL book, by Roberta Sparrow. As she studies the cover her image is reflected by the CLOSET DOOR MIRRORS.

The angle of the mirrors creates double image reflections other objects in the room... and Sam's reflection is pres in both of the panes. The digital CLOCK/RADIO shows 6:30 PM... She looks at the PICTURES OF HER FAMILY tucked away insid the book: Sam with her mother and father; Sam as a child her sister and brother; an old photo of the whole Darko family together... Tears come to her eyes as she focuses on an image of Donn and she puts them all down. She touches the SCAR on the i part of her right wrist... She then glances down and notices that the book is open t CHAPTER NINE - REMNANTS.
Remnants...

A portion of the text includes: Like Dreams that the Manipulated can have after journeys into Tangent or Fragmentary Universes, sounds and images may be transferr from one Tangent or Fragmentary Universe to another, as a corruptions exist on relative cosmic planes...
Sam wanders through the junkyard clad in her HOODED SWEATSHIRT and JEANS, with the MAKESHIFT BANDAGE wrapped around her right hand. The SHARD OF METAL protrudes from GASH by her temple.

She sees the junkyard as the phosphorescent DESTINY PLANE DEAD CARS, MACHINERY and piles of SCRAP METAL glow as stationary objects within the complex grid. A PAIR OF RAT follow their VECTOR SPEARS as they shimmy up the side of RUSTY TRACTOR... Sam treads effortlessly through the darkness, past the he of junk toward the decrepit STORAGE SHACK marked by the CORRUGATED ROOFING...
She stands before the shack, having discovered Vietnam To He squats in the darkened corner of the scrappy shelter, looks back at her through the eyeholes of a new mask --
He wears on his face the SCULPTURE made of SCRAP METAL, w has been formed into the COUNTENANCE OF THE MONSTER BUNNY
Hi, Tom. I like your new mask.
Tom trembles like the frightened animal he personifies as runs her fingers down one of the LONG, METALLIC EARS, dow one of the SHARPENED INCISORS of the EVIL-LOOKING GRIN...
Are you scared?

As this contact is made the tarnished metal becomes transparent, and the NEURONS in TOM'S BRAIN can be seen sending ELECTRIC IMPULSES, in turn RELEASING NEUROTRANSMITTERS and exciting OTHER NEURONS...
I know you can hear me...

A PORTAL forms around the shelter like a giant cylinder, enclosing them. Tom rises, afraid... Sam takes his hand.. The PORTAL shrinks and squeezes the walls until they bend inward, then begin to CREAK and RUMBLE --

Sam awakens to a fierce RUMBLING overhead. It happens again, and when she looks around she realizes she's underneath a highway overpass in BOXER SHORTS and a SHIRT, barefoot, lying on a FLAT AREA atop the CEMENT SLO that leads down to the road below. Alarmed by both the height and sanitation of her current position, she shifts her body and starts to slide down th SLOPE... Once on even ground, she notices a brand new `95 BMW comi toward her.
Perfect...
Jeremy pulls up next to her and rolls down his window.
Sam? Are you okay? What are doing?
I'm... yeah, I'm okay.
Jeremy gets out of the car and puts his hand on her shoul
You shouldn't be out here like this. C'mon, get in.
She allows herself to be led to the passenger side...
Sam leans her head back against the headrest as Jeremy drives.
You do that a lot?
I think it's genetic or something.
That's interesting... I've never heard of a specific genetic marker for sleepwalking.
It's just that my brother used to do it too.
He doesn't anymore?
No.
I think it's more common in children. When did your brother stop?
When he died.

Some WORKERS are in the process of   rebuilding the WINDM MAN WITH A HOSE sprays the side of   the WATER TANK in an attempt to wash off the burn marks   resembling the nearl imperceptible image of the MONSTER   BUNNY'S FACE...
Jeremy pulls into the motel parking lot. Sam hesitates fo moment before getting out.
I heard about your friend...
Sam doesn't say anything, so he goes on.
I wasn't gonna say anything... but then I thought I probably should, because if I didn't, it might be inconsiderate.
Well... okay. Thanks.
A beat.
So... what are you gonna do?
I don't know yet.
Sam brushes her mussed hair out of her face, still not wanting to go inside the motel room.
Do you believe that everything happens for a reason?
I know that for every action there's an equal and opposite reaction.
Yeah... I learned that in science.
And everything in the universe is in constant motion, as the universe is constantly expanding...
Yeah, but do you believe that everything happens for a reason, like in life?
You mean like destiny?
Jeremy thinks on this for a moment.
I think everyone has a purpose. Something they're meant to do. Like potential, but more clear-cut. For instance, I was destined to get my hands on the meteorite.
Really.
I'm making amazing discoveries every day, practically sleeping at the lab...
While he talks and becomes more excited he scratches nervously at his left forearm. It draws Sam's attention a from what he's saying.
I'm still doing some tests, but there's a metallic substance that's not showing up on the elemental CHARTS-
What happened to your arm?
Jeremy stops scratching. A small area on the inner part o his wrist is RAW and RED, partially SCABBED OVER.
It's just a rash.
Sam starts to get out of the car.
Sam, wait. Here...
He offers her a wad of cash. Sam hesitates.
BUT-
I know you need it. It's no big deal.
She accepts the money.
Thank you.

Sam shoves a load of her wet clothes into an industrial DRYER. She plugs in some quarters, presses the button, an sits back in a chair in front of the machine. As she stares into the whirling cylinder, her eyes defocu and she goes into a daze... TRANSITION TO:
ARIEL, the STUFFED TOY UNICORN spins on a ROTATING CHAIR.
Donnie!
(MOCKING) The Last Unicorn, by Samantha Darko!
Give it back!
There was once a unicorn named Ariel...
The SOUND of CRINKLING PAPER.
Donnie! You wrinkled it.
It's not wrinkled Sam. Just, ya know, flatten it in a book or something...
The chair is re-spun by an O.S. hand... and the UNICORN topples off onto the floor. BACK TO:
Sam snaps out of her vision when she hears Trudy and Fath Homeijer going around, asking for change.
Any small amount you could manage would really help.
They hover over a FAT MAN, holding out the COLLECTIONS JA
Piss off...
God bless you.
As they move down the line and approach Sam, she tenses u Trudy is about to go into her spiel when she recognizes h
Oh... hello.
She smiles at Sam politely, trying not to be too awkward. doesn't work. Aware of Sam's financial situation, she gives Father Home the hint to move on. He follows her lead.
(to Sam) God bless you.
Sam watches as they move on to the next person, suddenly filled with sadness...
Sam stands outside at a payphone, listening to it RING... Someone on the other end finally picks up:
Hello?
When Sam HEARS her MOTHER'S VOICE, it brings tears to her eyes. As if feeling her emotion over the phone line, Rose be HEARD starting to WHIMPER.
Samantha?
(in the background) Who is it, Rose?
(CRYING) Is that you?... if it's you, please come home.
Rose?
Although it looks like she wants to, Sam doesn't speak.

Vietnam Tom sits at his new squatting ground, looking out over all of El Reno. He peers at the twinkling lights thr his scrap metal BUNNY MASK, and cradles his RIFLE in his like a soldier at rest. He slowly turns and sees that Sam is sitting right next t him, facing the landscape. She wears her HOODED SWEATSHIR JEANS and the BANDAGE. The SHARD OF METAL is lodged in he forehead.
You wanna know what happens when you die?
Tom shakes his head no.
I wish it was me.
She looks at Tom.
I really want... to die.

Tom aims his gun at her face... He realizes that a FORCE FIELD has formed in between them because when the barrel of the gun touches it, the barrie bends and becomes slightly opaque. Sam is expressionless. Tom's finger trembles as he places on the trigger. He aims down the gun's sights, directly at Sam's RIGHT EY and sees a PHOSPHORESCENT GRID take shape like a coordina system on the force field. Sam's eye is in the CENTRAL QUADRANT... Tom pulls the trigger. TIME SLOWS DOWN. A liquid VECTOR SPEAR shoots out of the gun barrel. Immediately after, a BULLET is discharged and follows it. The VECTOR SPEAR passes cleanly through the grid, but whe the BULLET reaches it, the entire force field curves to accommodate the penetrating force... The spear juts out until it nearly touches Sam's eye... b then it stops. The bullet catches up and freezes at the s spot, centimeters from her face --
(DISAPPOINTED) Not today.
A HAND bangs on the door to room 15... After a beat, Sam opens it. She's got some makeup on, and spent more time on her hair than usual.
Hi.
