Chris lingers in front of the door, looking slightly uncomfortable.
I just stopped by to see how you were holdin' up.
I'm okay.
Sorry about the other night... I DIDN'T-
I was just upset. I shouldn't have snapped at you like that.
Chris nods, grateful for her forgiveness.
So what are you still doin' here? I figured you woulda hopped on a bus by now.
I'm gonna be taking off soon, I think. I just gotta figure some stuff out. It's quiet here.
I don't know if you're doin' anything later on, but...
He trails off when he HEARS a CAR pull up and park by his truck. He turns and sees that it's Jeremy in his BMW.
I was just on my way out. What were you gonna say?
Nothin'.
Okay, well... I'll see you later?
Yeah, sure.
He steps out of the way so Sam can shut and lock the door
Bye.
Bye.
Chris stares down Jeremy as Sam gets into his car and the drive off together.

Jeremy turns on the overhead florescent lights in the lab There are ROWS OF DESKS with MICROSCOPES and some PRECISI ROCK SLICING EQUIPMENT. As he walks to a desk near the back, he can barely contai his excitement. Sam follows, taking note of a LARGE RABBI an extremely SMALL CAGE...
Here's my station.
He unlocks a drawer in the lower portion of the desk and retrieves a BOX containing a tiny SLICE OF ROCK with a gr like PATTERN OF METALLIC CRYSTALS embedded in it.
That's it?
The rest is locked away somewhere else... somewhere safe. Everyone's gonna want a piece of this thing pretty soon.
He takes it over to an SCANNING ELECTRON MICROSCOPE and t it on. He places the meteorite slice in the microscope's VACUUM COLUMN through an AIRTIGHT DOOR.
You ever seen one of these?
No.
It's a scanning electron microscope. It uses electrons instead of light to scan the image.
A BLACK & WHITE IMAGE appears on the microscope's MONITOR it's a geometric collage of all shapes and shades.
At first I thought it was a siderite, but then I saw it was more than that. Much more. It does have a percentage of nickel and iron in it as I first suspected. But it also has something else.
He waits for Sam to take the bait.
And what's that?
He points to cluster of BRIGHT WHITES on the monitor. The shapes are strangely different than the others surroundin them.
An unrecognizable element. I've done all the tests. It doesn't exist on the periodic table.
Jeremy is practically beaming.
So this is pretty major.
This is history. I'm thinking of calling it framium.
Framium?
For my last name... Frame.
What if it's like... proof of some alien life-form from another galaxy or something.
Jeremy's tone becomes serious, and he starts to scratch a his left forearm as he talks.

It's very important you promise me you won't tell anyone else what I've showed you. I have to wait till just the right moment. NASA, or some secret government organization could come in here and take it away from me...
As Jeremy gets more worked up, he scratches harder...
And then later on, years from now, take credit for the discovery themselves.
I won't say anything.
Good.
Sam stares at him for a long beat, as if examining him.
There's this book I think you'd like... I got it from my physics teacher in high school.
The study of physics has unraveled some of the most profound mysteries of the universe.
It's called The Philosophy of Time Travel.
Time travel?
Yeah, but it's not really that. It's more like one scenario, or one type of scenario. I don't completely understand it...
Sam gazes at the cluster of white shapes on the monitor.
Another mystery.
What do you mean?
My life seems to be full of them.
Mysteries are what make life interesting...
Sam doesn't agree or disagree. She's become tense, becaus Jeremy's face is now in close proximity to hers.
You're a mystery to me, Samantha.
He goes in for a kiss, but Sam gently pushes him away.
Ow...
Jeremy retreats, shielding his left arm. Sam looks down a sees that the red, raw area has turned into a much bigger RASH, covering a large part of his wrist and extending on his forearm.
That doesn't look good.
I should get some Hydrocortisone.
He looks pathetic, and Sam feels sorry for him.
(regarding the attempted
Sorry about that.
I'm sorry. I should've know better. You barely know me, right?
And nobody really calls my Samantha. Just my mom and dad.
Jeremy manages a smile, and Sam smiles back.
Chris is at work, stocking shelves inside the department store... He checks his watch, stops what he's doing and grabs a PA OF CIGARETTES from his breast pocket -- time for a smoke break.
The TRACTOR-TRAILER TRUCK carrying the JALOPY breaches th crest of the hill, descending on the intersection...
Chris lights up a cigarette...

He watches as the TRACTOR-TRAILER hits the pothole, but passes safely through the intersection, making a right. Something about the sight of this strikes Chris so much t his cigarette falls out of his mouth.
Father Homeijer and Trudy stroll down a quiet street with their COLLECTIONS JAR, and arrive at a fork in the road.
You take this street, I'll take that one?
Without warning, Trudy kisses him on the cheek.
Good luck.
Father Homeijer blushes, but Trudy smiles at him in a friendly manner. They move off in separate directions...
Father Homeijer raps on the door of Dusty's house. No ans

The priest lets himself into the garage, which is open bu deserted. He notices COREY'S CHEVROLET. He steps up to th GARAGE ENTRANCE and knocks... No one comes to the door, but he notices that it's slight ajar.
Dusty?
He can hear COUNTRY MUSIC playing low within.
Are you home, son?
He lets himself inside...
Father Homeijer walks into the dingy kitchen. The SINK is full of DIRTY DISHES. A coating of GRIME over everything.
The sleeping PIT BULL stirs...
The priest sees that the COUNTRY SONG is coming from a ST that sits on the kitchen counter.
(calling out) Dusty? I'd like to trouble you for a small donation...

The COUNTRY SONG comes to a close, and the tape runs out. With the music gone, the priest cocks his head to a new s -- soft, distant CRYING. He looks curiously toward the CELLAR DOOR... [Note: The CRYING SOUND should be identical to the one that drew Cor out of the motel room.]

Father Homeijer slowly descends the rickety BASEMENT STEP At the bottom, he finds a STRING that connects to a bare overhead BULB... He creeps along the dusty cement floor, past an old WASHER/DRYER, continuing toward the source of the CRYING, which has become more pronounced. He wrinkles his nose at foul smell...
Who's there?

He rounds a corner, and when he sees Billy Moorcroft he's nearly frozen in shock -- The boy is locked inside a large, METAL DOG'S CAGE. He si on the floor of the cage, rocking back and forth. He is pale, bruised and slick with sweat, clothed only in pair of SOILED BRIEFS. Beside him is an aluminum WATER BO and some scraps of WHITE BREAD. The floor beneath him is soaked with URINE and scattered FECES. Father Homeijer makes the sign of the cross.

Dusty's place is surrounded by FIRE TRUCKS, POLICE CARS a an AMBULANCE. Billy Moorcroft is wrapped in a blanket and being tended to by PARAMEDICS. Father Homeijer stands near the boy, being interviewed by DETECTIVE. Dusty is handcuffed and being loaded into the back of a cruiser by Officer O'Dell and another policeman, OFFICER HINES (28).
Get in there, you sick fuck...

Dusty says nothing as O'Dell shoves him in and slams the door... The two officers turn when they see RANDY'S DAD'S CAR pul next to the property. Randy is in the driver's seat, look confused. Ruth hops out of the passenger seat and darts toward the house -- -- but she is cut off and grabbed by a POLICEMAN. ANOTHER OFFICER goes to talk to Randy in the car.
Wheels turning, O'Dell addresses Hines:
(regarding Dusty) Let him rot in there for a few minutes, maybe till the news guys show up... I'm gonna go finish checkin' upstairs.

O'Dell lets himself into Ruth's bedroom. It's a mess -- h CLOTHES are all over the floor, and crinkled ROCK POSTERS litter the walls. Next to her bed is a FRAMED PICTURE of she and Randy. O'D starts to rifle through her desk drawers, one after anoth He tosses the closet, throwing out clothes and shoes... u he finds the SHOEBOX. He opens it up, satisfied...
Officer Hines stands by the door, looking in at O'Dell covertly.
Sam lies in bed in front of the television. A NEWS BULLET comes on about Billy's Moorcroft's rescue:

We have an update this morning on our breaking news of Billy Moorcroft, the El Reno youth who was kidnapped over 15 months ago, and rescued yesterday afternoon by Father Homeijer of Mount Calvary Church. Billy's condition at this time is considered stable...
Sam stares at the television, dumbfounded. The news cuts the scene of the rescue, where Father Homeijer is being
Father, what led you to this particular house on this particular day?

I was out collecting donations in order to help rebuild my church, Mount Calvary, which recently burned down. Clearly the Lord works in mysterious ways. This is nothing less than divine intervention...
As Sam's walking away from the motel, she looks up to the at a PASSING JET...
No matter how well you think you know somebody, you just never really know...
Sam sits at the booth where she and Corey sat before, and Agatha sets down a glass of ORANGE JUICE.
Dusty Gibbens has been comin' in here for coffee ever since I can remember... gives me the shivers.
Ted pipes up from behind the counter:
They should hang guys like that. Only thing bothers me is how many of `em are still out there...
Chris enters the diner and catches the end of Ted's rant.
Hang `em all.
(to Sam) I'll be right back with your breakfast.
As Agatha moves off, Chris sees Sam and approaches her ta
May I?
Sure.
I guess you heard.
Yeah.
It's so messed up... I feel bad that I recommended him now.
Agatha notices that Chris has sat down with Sam.
What can I get you, honey?
Uh... sausage, eggs, coffee, please.
White or wheat?
Wheat toast, please...
He refocuses his attention back on Sam.
If I had kids, I'd be worried sick about `em in a world like this. I'm sure your parents must be.
Hey, you could've been some crazy rapist serial killer.
Agatha is there with his coffee just in time to hear this last part. She gives Chris and Sam each an odd look befor setting the coffee down and leaving.
You turned out okay.
Yeah, but everybody doesn't.
I can take care of myself.
I'm sure you can... but I wouldn't feel right if I didn't tell you about Jeremy.
What about him?
I don't know what you have goin' with him... but you shouldn't be hangin' around him. Let's just leave it at that.
What makes you think you can tell me who I can and can't hang around with?
It's just that I know him better than you do. He lived in my neighborhood when we were kids.
So?
So he used to do weird stuff... to animals.
Sam waits for him to go on.

My sister lost her pet rabbit once, and we went all over the neighborhood lookin' for it. We were just about to call it quits when we heard something comin' from Jeremy's garage. He'd stuck it in a trash can and put the lid on.
Sam looks shocked and a little disgusted.
It was half starved by the time we got it home. Died just a few days later.
How old was he?
I don't know, just a couple years. Cute little black and white-
No. Jeremy.
He was like nine, probably.
He was just a kid, he didn't know what he was doing.
When you were nine years old did you know it was wrong to put a living creature in the trash can and leave it there?
Sam's had enough.
Chris... you're a nice guy, but you don't have to be looking out for me. You're not my dad, you're not my big brother...
Chris hangs his head, frustrated.
O'Dell stands at the bars of Dusty's jail cell. Dusty lie his cot and stares up at the ceiling.
You know what they do to faggot-ass perverts like you in maximum security, dontcha?
O'Dell chuckles, enjoying this immensely.
Disgusting fuckin' piece a' shit like you...
O'Dell, now dressed in plainclothes, is on the way to his in the far corner of the back lot. He HEARS someone come the door behind him, but doesn't turn until he HEARS his VOICE.
Hey, O'Dell...
I'm on my way out... what do you need?
Hines catches up with him and they walk and talk.
I'm not gonna bullshit ya.
Okay...
I saw you snatch the drugs outta that house.
O'Dell's face grows cold but he doesn't slow his pace.
I don't think I know what the hell you're talkin' about.
Don't bullshit me either...
Hines grabs his shoulder to stop him. O'Dell eyes his han
I don't wanna turn you in.
Then what do you want?
How much you think you'll get when you unload it?
O'Dell keeps cool, but resents being muscled.
Depends.
I'll take forty percent this time, but from now on it's fifty-fifty.
What do you mean from now on?
I got a pretty good idea this ain't the first time you done this. Won't be the last, will it?
Hines extends his hand and smiles. O'Dell shakes it. Grudgingly...
After Hines turns on him and jogs back to the station hou O'Dell kicks the ground angrily.
Shit!

When he looks up, he's startled by a pair of eyes that pe from the bushes nearby. Upon closer inspection, he sees t it's Vietnam Tom in his SKI MASK. Nervous about how much he's heard, O'Dell takes an aggres stance.
Come on outta there. Now!
He becomes tense when Tom emerges, because he sees that h got his RIFLE.
What the fuck you doin' carryin' that around in the town proper?
O'Dell realizes that he's not holding it in a threatening manner, but cradling it in his arms.
Hand it over. Right now!
Tom steps toward him ever so slowly. O'Dell reaches out a Tom hands him the gun, stock first.
I should arrest you and throw you in jail, you know that? Crazy sonofabitch...
Tom looks at the ground, hunched over meekly.
Get the fuck outta my sight.
O'Dell looks around as Tom shuffles off, making sure no o witnessed the transaction.
Sam trudges up the wooded hill to the vantage point, carr The Philosophy of Time Travel book. It's quiet and peacef and everything's bathed in golden light.

She comes upon Tom's new squatting ground in a secluded a near the lookout, and looks around before approaching. When she sees the handmade BUNNY MASK lying among his thi she puts the book under her arm and reaches down to pick up. She runs her fingers down the long, shiny ears, nose, and jagged teeth... She doesn't realize that Tom is standing close behind her When she senses his presence she's startled.
Sorry...

She sets the BUNNY MASK down where she found it. Tom says nothing. He seems neither surprised nor irritated to find there. He walks up beside her and sits, facing the view. After a long beat, Sam sits down beside him. To her surpr Tom begins to speak:
My mom told me someday everybody would understand. She said it was my job to look out for the town... so that's what I do. That's what I always do.
Sam listens to him intently.
They don't know why. They don't even want me here, but I still have to protect them.
They're lucky to have someone to protect them.
I'm used to it... I'm lucky to have a job to do. Some people don't have any reason to be here at all.
I know what you mean...
Tom turns and looks at her strangely.
You're more important than all of us.

Sam peers into Tom's pale blue eyes through his ski mask. Without knowing why, she reaches out and touches the mask When she starts to pull it off Tom grabs her hand, stoppi her -- not too rough, but forceful. Sam's scared for a moment, but Tom lets her go. His eyes drift down to The Philosophy of Time Travel book by her s Sam sees him staring, so she picks it up and hands it to When Tom sees the cover, his cold eyes are filled with emotion. Sam sees how struck he is, but doesn't understan
Do you like to read?
Tom says nothing.
You can borrow it...
Again, Tom does not speak. After a beat, Sam gets up slow and walks away, leaving Tom with the book.

Jeremy is at the department store in the FIRST AID SECTIO picking out some GAUZE and DISINFECTANT. When he looks do the aisle and sees Sam, he moves toward her quickly... He disturbs her while she's looking at some FEMININE HYGI PRODUCTS.
Sam...
When he sees the items that she's shopping for, he seems more embarrassed than she does.
Oh, hi Jeremy.
Hi... sorry.
That's okay, what's up?
Nothing... just that I haven't see you around for the past few days. I was worried. I thought you might've taken off.
No... I've been around. Going for lots of walks.
I stopped by the motel.
Sam finds his manner a bit odd.
Like I said, I've been in and out.
Well, there's something I wanted to ask you. You know that book you mentioned?
Yeah...
I'd really love to check it out.
Oh...
Sam's face darkens, and Jeremy picks up on it.
You said you'd show it to me sometime, and I've got a hunch it could really help me in some of my studies related to-
I don't have it anymore.
What?
I kind of... gave it to someone.
To who? Why?
I'm sorry. I just... forgot that I said you could borrow it, and this GUY-
What guy?
Well... that Vietnam Tom guy.
Jeremy is furious.
Vietnam Tom!? You gave away the book to Vietnam Tom!?
Sam backs away from him. He's getting louder and out of control.
I don't fucking believe what you're telling me!
It's just a book...
He's a fucking bum! And you chose him over me!?
No... I just-
Suddenly, a hand comes down on Jeremy's shoulder. He turn and finds Chris standing behind him.
That's enough.
Sam is relieved. Jeremy glares at Chris.
This is none of your business.
It is, actually. You're disturbing my customers. Get out.
Jeremy brushes past Sam as he leaves, and she and Chris a left alone. There's a definite "I told you so" aura.
(MUTTERING) You didn't have to do that.
Just doin' my job.
Sam starts to walk away, at first forgetting the products needed. She comes back to get them, slightly flustered. C turns and leaves her in peace.
(as he's walking away) You're welcome.
Father Homeijer and Trudy are sitting on the couch in the living room of his quaint house, sharing a BOTTLE OF CHAMPAGNE.
I never had any doubts in you, or in the Lord.
I know that. And we both truly appreciate all your faith and hard work...
They sip their champagne. Trudy glows.
We needed a miracle, but we got two instead.
Trudy grabs the bottle and tries to refill his glass, but priest puts his hand over it.
I think I've had enough.
One more glass won't hurt you. You deserve it, Father...
O'DELL'S CAR pulls up to an old warehouse and parks.
Where the hell are they?
Hines is nervous. He lights a cigarette.
They'll be here. Just take it easy.

Tom wears his metal BUNNY MASK. Sam wears her HOODED SWEATSHIRT and JEANS, and her right hand is BANDAGED. The METAL SHARD is embedded under the skin of her forehead... They move slowly and methodically until they reach the ce of the empty lot. There are lights on in the closed department store, but the parking lot is mostly dark.
Why do you talk to me?
TOM'S VOICE is MUFFLED behind his mask.
Same reason you talk to me...
Tom cocks his head, unsure of the answer.
Because I can see how special you are.
Why can't other people?
They will. Only one day left.
They both turn toward an area in the lot where the SHOPPI CARTS are stored. The METAL STORAGE RACK starts to trembl and burn with COSMIC ENERGY...
Father Homeijer finishes his glass of champagne. Trudy is already done with hers, and she takes his glass and sets on the coffee table. She moves closer to him on the couch
Trudy...
She puts her hand on his leg.
I see the way you look at me, Father...
She moves in closer... He looks uncomfortable.
I want you too.
She's about to kiss him, but Father Homeijer stops her.
I can't do this. I'm a man of the cloth... and you'd regret it.
He takes her by the hand, reminding her of the WEDDING BA on her finger.
SHOPPING CARTS start to roll out of the RACK by themselve following their own liquid VECTOR SPEARS. Tom stands staring at them. He is flanked by Sam...
Officer Hines walks to the edge of the woods beside the warehouse and unzips his pants...
With GLOVED HANDS, O'Dell grabs VIETNAM TOM'S RIFLE out o the trunk...
Trudy's head is buried in her hands and she bawls.
I feel like such an idiot...
Father Homeijer doesn't know what to say.
Hines finishes relieving himself and comes out into the o from the side of the building. O'Dell is waiting for him.
What the fuck-
O'Dell shoots him in the chest. He is cool and calm. He throws the rifle down on the ground...

The SHOPPING CARTS whirl in an circle of ever-increasing speed around Vietnam Tom and Sam. The RUBBER WHEELS squea the cement until they start to melt... The VECTOR SPEARS lead the carts in a spiral that hones i closer and closer to the two of them. Sam is stoic. Tom i awe...
We travel at breath-taking speed through a PORTAL as it weaves through millions of STARS, then an ATMOSPHERIC BARRIER...

When it looks like they'll be crushed by the scudding met or combusted by the cosmic energy, the WORM-LIKE PORTAL f the sky reaches down and encloses Tom and Sam like a vacu There's a brilliant FLASH OF LIGHT -- TRANSITION TO:

CHRIS' TRUCK pulls into the lot early in the morning, and gets out wearing his work uniform. Still groggy, he's abo to walk into the store when something catches his eye... CRANE UP to FIND a STRUCTURE made of all the SHOPPING CAR as chilling and impressive as a crop circle, in the shape an immense FIBONACCI SPIRAL. The metal of the carts has b fused together, and they're stacked in an ascending manne that reaches an apex in the center, like a cone. Chris is mystified... CUT TO:
Two POLICE CRUISERS speed down a street in town...
COPS, including Officer O'Dell, converge on Vietnam Tom i the park, where he sits on the SWING in his ski mask...
Get down on the ground!
Tom looks up at them calmly, without fear.
Get down on the ground, now!

He obeys them and two Cops jump on him and put him in cuf One of them pulls up his head and rips off his ski mask - Tom's face is a mass of SCARS. Both his cheeks, forehead chin are marred by scar tissue born from long, deep gashe O'Dell looks into his sad, blue eyes...
Tom is slammed against a table. An OFFICER takes his hand roughly and sticks his fingers into some ink to take his prints -- JUMP CUT TO:
Name?
Tom stands for his booking photos -- JUMP CUT TO:
(getting angry) What's your name?
The POLICEMAN stands over Vietnam Tom, who sits defeated chair. A YOUNG OFFICER approaches.
We found this on him...
He passes the Policeman a set of DOG TAGS on a CHAIN. The name on the tags is: THOMAS WARD SPARROW.

Sam walks toward the motel, wearing JEANS and a T-SHIRT.. When she sees JEREMY'S BMW parked in the lot she stops sh But it's too late -- he's already seen her and is getting of the car. He's got a bouquet of FLOWERS.
Hi, Sam...
He passes her the flowers.
I hope you can forgive the way I acted.
That was pretty weird.
I know. I just...
Jeremy is awkward and shy.
I've been so wrapped up with the meteorite. I haven't been eating or sleeping much. I think I'm just drained... but that's no excuse.
It's alright.
I was wondering if you'd let me make it up to you.
You don't need to-
Please... let me take you to watch the fireworks tonight.
I don't think so.
It's gonna be spectacular. There's gonna be a meteor shower that coincides with the show... I mean, how often does that happen?
Sam still isn't sure.
I just wanna be your friend.
I was supposed to see `em with Chris, but... he's stuck at work.
So, what do you say? Will you go with me?
Gimme a sec. Lemme grab my sweatshirt...
Jeremy beams.

Chris is in the department store parking lot with a crew EMPLOYEES. They work together to pry apart the numerous SHOPPING CARTS with CROWBARS. They've made some progress, still a long way to go. Chris is distracted by JEREMY'S BMW as it cruises through nearby intersection... After it passes, Chris looks up at some OMINOUS CLOUDS congregating in the darkening sky. From the CLOUDS above the store -- PAN DOWN TO FIND:
The lookout, and Jeremy's car riding up the hill. There a OTHER CARS parked to watch the upcoming display, but Jere drives to a more SECLUDED AREA... (Music suggestion: 4th July, by Soundgarden.)
Jeremy spreads a blanket on the ground of a private grove wears a LIGHT JACKET, and sets down a GROCERY BAG. Sam ha her HOODED SWEATSHIRT tied around her waist.
Shouldn't we go back out there where we can see?
No, this'll be perfect. See right there?
He points to an area near the tops of the trees.
That's right where the fireworks'll come up.
And we can see the meteors better without all the lights from the town.
Sam sits down on the blanket and checks her watch. Jeremy pokes around in the grocery bag.
So what's in the bag?
You'll see...
Sam takes her HOODED SWEATSHIRT from around her waist and puts it on to fight the cold...
There's one!
Sam spots a METEOR as it streaks across the sky --
JEREMY'S HAND holds a flaring ROMAN CANDLE --
Here it goes!
A SPARKLING GREEN BALL shoots out of the stick into the a Sam looks up at it and smiles. Jeremy shoots off colorful ball after ball, aiming in different directions.
They're pretty.
After his stick fizzles out:
You wanna try one?
Sam shrugs... He grabs another out of the grocery bag, an Sam gets up slowly. He passes her the ROMAN CANDLE, and s accepts it with her RIGHT HAND...
Just hold it straight up.
Sam holds it and Jeremy flicks his LIGHTER. The WICK catches...
It's goin'!

Sam smiles and holds the stick as far away from her face possible. She closes her eyes... But the wick burns down extremely fast. The FIRST BALL ge stuck at the top and implodes, causing the whole thing to catch fire.
Ow!
Drop it!
He runs over and stamps it out as quickly as he can...
Fucking faulty one...
Sam nurses her burned hand.
Are you okay?
I think so...
Jeremy inspects her hand -- there's a large BLISTER.
You need to get that covered...
Jeremy takes off his jacket. He then removes his T-shirt starts to tear off a piece.
What are you doing?
It's okay...
The bank sign shows 8:59 PM. The display flashes to: JULY 1995... It changes to the countdown: 00 DAYS, 00 HOURS, 0 MINUTES, 03 SECONDS... 02 SECONDS... 01 SECONDS...
Jeremy finishes wrapping the piece of his T-shirt around Sam's hand, creating the MAKESHIFT BANDAGE.
How's it feel?
A little better...

The FIREWORKS suddenly begin, and fill the sky above the grove with bursts of bright, multi-colored lights. Sporad METEORS rain down at the same time. It's magnificent. After a beat, Sam looks over at Jeremy... The fireworks illuminate his torso, and she is appalled t see that the raw, reddish RASH has spread to cover the greater part of it.
Good God...
Jeremy looks down as if he'd forgotten, then quickly pick his jacket and puts it back on.
(ALARMED) Is that from the meteorite?
I barely even notice it anymore. I'm sure it'll go away soon.
He zips up his jacket tight.
Are you fucking kidding me?
Do you think I'm disgusting?
The question takes Sam by surprise.
No... I just think you should get it looked at-
Before Sam can finish, Jeremy crams his mouth into hers f forceful kiss... Sam shoves him away sharply.
What the hell are you doing?
So you do find me disgusting. Which is it, Sam, I can't take much more of this shit!
Jesus Christ...
He tries to grab her, but Sam turns and runs --
Come here!
Sam tears through the woods, Jeremy close behind her. The FIREWORKS CRACK and POP in the sky above...
Sam! Stop!
Sam jumps over a fallen log in the dark... Jeremy hits it dead on with his shins and goes head over heels --
FUCK!
He picks himself up and charges even faster --
Tom sits alone in his jail cell, morose, staring at the floor. He looks up when he senses someone approaching...

Sam sprints by the area of Vietnam Tom's squatting ground FIREWORKS continue to EXPLODE and shower overhead, and so PEOPLE can be HEARD LAUGHING and SHOUTING from the main parking area, not far away... Sam runs toward the VOICES -- But Jeremy grabs her from behind and spins her around!
Why are you doing this?
I just wanna talk to you!
She struggles against his grip. The EXPLOSIONS and the RU from CROWD mask their noise.
Stop it!
Sam raises her knee and connects hard with his groin. He starts to double over, but recovers quickly and smacks he across the face --
Fucking bitch!

Sam is stunned, and Jeremy takes her by the shoulders and shoves her hard -- Sam stumbles backwards and falls, cracking her head on th metal BUNNY MASK. She rolls over onto her back, REVEALING SHARD OF METAL that protrudes from the GASH by her temple She struggles no more.
Tom stands in his cell to meet the entity that approaches
Chris and the other Employees stop working and look up at sky, now roiling with sinister, SUPERNATURAL CLOUDS...
Jeremy slowly creeps to where Sam lies... Her eyes are op and she is completely still.
Sam?...
Jeremy crouches beside her, and when he puts two fingers her neck to feel for a pulse, he starts to tremble... The raining METEORS and FIREWORKS illuminate the SMOKE an the BLACK CLOUDS overhead...
Vietnam Tom walks up to the CELL BARS... He comes face to face with Sam.
She stares back at him through the bars from the other si She wears her HOODED SWEATSHIRT and the BANDAGE. Light gl off the METAL lodged in her HEAD WOUND.

Jeremy speeds frantically down the hill, away from the parking area and the continuing fireworks display. Tears stream down his cheeks... He cuts the wheel when a pair of HEADLIGHTS blind him and vehicle cuts him off. His car skids out, and he sees it's CHRIS' TRUCK that has almost hit him. Chris jumps out, yanks open Jeremy's door and grabs him b the shirt collar. He yells over the FIREWORKS:
Where the hell is Sam?
(FRANTIC) I don't know... I don't know...
Jeremy stomps on the gas pedal, and Chris is forced to un him as his BMW navigates around the truck and barrels dow the hill...

As Chris approaches Vietnam Tom's squatting ground, the FIREWORKS DISPLAY is in the midst of the GRANDE FINALE. Showers of light BURST and CRACKLE in steady succession. PEOPLE SCREAM in approval from the parking area nearby... Chris comes upon Sam's lifeless form.
No...

He stoops by her, picks her up and hugs her limp body close... As he does this, Vietnam Tom approaches from behind him. Chris turns to face him but says nothing, still holding S The WIND picks up and blows in gusts around them... Tom looks down at the two of them for a moment, then reac down and picks up his BUNNY MASK. The EVIL GRIN is red wi SAM'S BLOOD, and one of the teeth is missing...

The last of the fireworks display occurs, leaving the nig full of SMOKE, HELLISH CLOUDS and an increasing number of bright-tailed METEORS -- the APOCALYPSE. Amongst the churning clouds, a tornado-like PORTAL cuts through the sky and touches down somewhere in the town. I swirling and vast, stretching down from limitless space..
15 days... 18 hours...
Tom puts on the BUNNY MASK...
45 minutes... 6 seconds...      45 minutes... 6 seconds.. And focuses on a single METEOR that plummets toward the yawning VORTEX, using telekinetic power to guide it...
The METEOR blazes through the WORMHOLE --

head_text.subj: THE BARS TO THE JAIL CELL STRAIGHTEN --
SHOPPING CARTS SWIRL IN A DECONSTRUCTING SPIRAL --
O'DELL GIVES TOM BACK HIS RIFLE --
FATHER HOMEIJER PLACES BILLY MOORCROFT BACK IN HIS CAGE -
THE CHURCH REBUILDS ITSELF OUT OF FLAMES --
THE THREE CROSSES IN IMITATION OF CALVARY RIGHT THEMSELVE
SAM'S FACE DIPS BENEATH THE SURFACE OF RANDY'S POOL --

text: The clock on the BANK SIGN shows 3:30 AM -- then flashes JUNE 19, 1995... It changes again, this time to a countdo to the JULY 4TH FIREWORKS CELEBRATION: 15 DAYS, 17 HOURS, MINUTES, 57 SECONDS... 56 SECONDS... 55 SECONDS...

Sam awakens suddenly from a nightmare. She lies atop the blankets wearing a T-SHIRT and BOXER SHORTS. She looks ov and sees Corey passed out on the other full-size bed. TWO PLASTIC CUPS, EMPTY SODA CANS, and the BOTTLE are on nightstand between them, the liquor partially consumed. T CLOCK/RADIO reads 3:30 AM.

Vietnam Tom sits atop the platform, more than 30 feet up, wearing his ski mask and holding his rifle. The surface o the platform is littered with TATTERED CLOTHING, a WATER BOTTLE, CANS OF FOOD and SCRAPS OF A TARP. Relaxed and at peace, Tom looks up to the clear night sky a TREMOR starts to build, he takes off his ski mask and g out over his town... He smiles. Suddenly, there's a brilliant flash of GREEN LIGHT -- deafening THUNDER -- a blinding EXPLOSION -- CUT TO:

Dusty sits and stares at his CELLAR DOOR... Trudy holds a PICTURE OF FATHER HOMEIJER and cries... Ruth snorts some in her room... Jeremy scratches his LEFT FOREARM in his sleep... Billy Moorcroft shivers from the chill in his CAGE... Officer O'Dell sits alone in his patrol car, fingering the trigger of his PISTOL... TRANSITION TO:

Where the towering windmill once stood is now only a CRAT about 5 feet deep and 10 feet in diameter, with charred b of wood and metal strewn everywhere. Ground water spurts the broken well seal. A cantaloupe-sized METEORITE sits in the center of the crater... Two FIREMEN haul out the meteorite as Sam and O'Dell arri on the scene. There are PARAMEDICS, a CORONER and other POLICEMEN there as well, and a large area has been cordon off with POLICE TAPE.
Corey is there looking on, as well as Chris Holt, Phil Coulter, and other local CITIZENS. TOM'S REMAINS are carr off in a BLACK BAG...
Oh my God...
Sam moves to stand by Corey. The overall mood is grim, an Frank stands peering at the wreckage with a long face.
I don't believe it...
The Firemen drop the porous, misshapen clod by his feet.
This is just a tragedy.
Officer O'Dell steps up beside him and kicks the meteorit with his boot.
Sell that thing off to some meteorologist nerd club, I bet you could do okay.
Do I look like the type of guy that's gonna try and profit off another man's death? You should be ashamed of yourself.
(EMBARRASSED) I was just sayin'...
Sam looks down on the ground and sees Tom's multi-colored MASK... She picks it up.
What are you doing?
As she caresses the fibers with her fingers, she is fille with unwarranted emotion...
Sam and Corey are on their way back to the motel room whe they turn and see that Chris has followed them.
Hey...
Hey.
So you guys stayed here last night?
One of us did.
Sam gives Corey a look. Chris decides to ignore the comme
What's up with your car?
It's gonna take a couple days.
For a water pump?
Sam and Corey shrug.
It's none of my business, but...
He's distracted when JEREMY'S BMW pulls up and parks. He out and hustles across the field toward the crash site...
What?
Chris regains his train of thought:
I was just gonna say, if you wanted, I could give you a ride back.
He looks right at Sam when he says this. He then glances at Corey, as if just remembering that she were there.
You too. I mean, I could give you both a ride.
To Middlesex, Virginia? Do you-
(INTERRUPTING) I'll go.
(PISSED) What?
I think I wanna go.
